title: DevOps till Booli
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Hjälpa utvecklare att effektivt bygga våra produkter
* Ansvara för drift av Kubernetes-kluster och centrala tjänster
* Vidareutveckla vår tekniska plattform


 Att jobba som DevOps till Booli
   

  

 Varje månad använder miljontals personer Booli och Hittamäklare för att ta beslut om sitt boende. Våra bostadsvärderingar används av både privatpersoner och bank. Vårt analysverktyg Booli Pro är en av Sveriges ledande verktyg för professionella aktörer på bostadsmarknaden. Allt detta tack vare vår tekniska plattform som gör det möjligt att med små smidiga team samla in stora mängder data och bygga många tjänster och produkter.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en DevOps-utvecklare för att fortsätta att drifta och förbättra vår plattform. Vi arbetar med Kubernetes och har kluster både på egna servrar i datahallar i Stockholm och på AWS. Det gör att vi kan utnyttja AWS styrkor i skalbarhet och flexibilitet där det passar och samtidigt kostnadseffektivt och med höga krav på sekretess och personuppgiftshantering kan använda våra egna servrar där det passar bättre.
   

  

 För att vi ska bli effektivare och inte begränsa oss använder vi "standardization by tooling" dvs att vi genom bra verktyg gör det enkelt att göra samma, men samtidigt tillåter att vi testar nya vägar och idéer.
   

  

 För att arbeta som DevOps-utvecklare hos oss bör du ha erfarenhet av Kubernetes, docker och några av de system vi använder som t.ex. Talos Linux, Mayastor, MySQL, Mongodb, Elasticsearch, Grafana, Kibana, Kafka. Har du erfarenhet av att köra Kubernetes på egna servrar är det extra meriterande för där vill vi stärka upp teamet lite mer. Det finns stora möjligheter att påverka och själv styra hur man lägger upp sitt arbete. Vi vill gärna att du kommer med idéer på hur vi kan förbättra vår plattform framåt och är öppna för att testa nytt för att lära oss och bli mer effektiva.
   

  

 I dagsläget jobbar vi hybrid och vi tror att det är viktigt att träffa varandra på kontoret. Boolis kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm på Olof Palmes gata och här sitter vi i ljusa och luftiga lokaler. Booli har också en varm och personlig kultur där vi ofta och gärna ses för t.ex. en årlig kräftskiva, regelbundna AW:s eller karaokekvällar.
   

  

 Nu är det semestertider! Vänligen notera att återkoppling kan dröja längre än vanligt. Vi kommer att gå igenom ansökningar samt återkoppla from 12/8, vecka 33.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Ansvarstagande
* Initiativtagande
* Lagspelare
* Nyfiken
* Nytänkande


 Annars då?
   

  

 Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

title: Method developer
description:
**General**
 Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 The purpose is to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for people and the planet.
   

  

 It is a bold and an exciting journey with no finite end. Our innovative spirit and determination are what keep us going until we reach the science-based targets that Scania, as one of the pioneers of the industry, has proudly committed to.
   

  

 Within that the E/E-sector at Scania including embedded development is as well undergoing a large transformation to become more flow-oriented and with the goal to develop faster and with better quality! This affects on how around 1000 employees are working with development of Scania’s electrical and embedded systems.
   

  

 Of importance to succeed is to have clear structures, processes and information management in place. The transformation within Embedded Systems means that present way of working is needed to be challenged and updated. Additional, increasing of legal requirements nowadays in this area, as example Software Update Management system (SUMS) and Cyber Security Management System (CSMS), challenge this transformation.
   

  

**The Team**
 Embedded Method development team (EEDDM) is fresh and growing fast. Together with all co-workers involved in embedded process and tool development we either improve existing or develop new methods that are used across the organization TRATON. With a high focus on safety and quality, our aim is to increase the speed in our product development without jeopardizing the premium level from our products. The team, which consists of different people from around the world, is currently working in a modern workflow both remotely and on side.
   

  

**Your new Job**
 Some examples of your working tasks as method developer could be:
   

  

* Define a method or a concept by collecting experience and deep diving in the needs.
* Develop the method itself by discussing with stakeholders and describing it in a documented way.
* Identify the need of tools and in that matter define the functions specifications.
* Implement the methods by teaching, coaching and defend your method to the stakeholders.
* Maintenance is also part of your responsibility where you will implement improvements and adapt the methods for the new business needs and based in the implementation experience.


 As you might already read out you will work cross-functional and cross-organizational in a global environment as well as be involved in all project phases from early concept development onwards. You will be networking to a large extent.
   

  

 In our team we have an open atmosphere when it comes to expression opinions and encourage our employees to act with integrity in order to feel proud of what we deliver and take responsibility for what we do.
   

  

 If you appreciate tasks where you can use your strategic overview and your values to guide others in doing what’s right, then don’t hesitate and join us!
   

  

**Your Profile**
 As our new method developer you need to have good communication skills as well as good inter-personal skills. You come with a system architect or system development background preferably in embedded systems or you have a technical background. It will be a plus if you have knowledge of cyber security, Software update or worked as a System owner.
   

  

 Your ability to see the whole picture and how different parts within the Requirements Engineering domain will be an asset in this role.
   

  

 As a person, you are truly interested in other people’s opinions to understand their needs of different method users and propose solutions. You should be able to transfer your work results in a clear and simple way either verbally or in a presentation form to stakeholders and also document technical instructions and guidelines.
   

  

 Since you will be working in an international environment you can express yourself fluently, both in speech and writing, in English.
   

  

**We offer**
 At Scania Software factory, we want you to succeed and develop, and together we contribute to a sustainable future.
   

  

 Working at Scania you are offered benefits such as a mutual performance bonus, occupational pension, distance working in Sweden, flexible working hours, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer our direct bus service between Stockholm City - Liljeholmen - Södertälje, the Scania Job Express.
   

  

**Contact Information**
**Please Get In Touch With Me, The Hiring Manager**
 Sascha Sturm, sascha.sturm@scania.com.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: IT-Specialist Beslutstöd
description:
*Som IT Specialist Beslutsstöd på Länsförsäkringar AB ansvarar du för att driva utveckling, livscykelhantera och optimera våra beslutsstödsystem. Du leder ett agilt team, säkerställer hög kvalitet och tillgänglighet i våra IT-lösningar samt ingår i ett framgångsrikt team.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som IT Specialist och Product Owner inom Tåg Vår Gemensamma Bankinformation på Länsförsäkringar Bank, kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva framgångsrika IT-lösningar och säkerställa kvalitet och tillgänglighet i våra IT-system.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta operativt och taktiskt med beslutsstödsområdet, inklusive BankDW, IPA (bankens nya plattform för informationsförsörjning och analys) och Splunk. Som Product Owner leder du ett lean agilt team för att maximera leveransvärde och säkerställa kvalitet och tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden i rollen kommer vara:
   

  

* Leda teamets arbete mot uppsatta mål, delmål och releaser.
* Äga, upprätthålla och prioritera teamets backlogg.
* Aktivt bidra till Beslutsstöd som helhet och hantera framtagandet av behov.
* Säkerställa både användar- och IT-perspektiven i all utveckling samt ansvara för dialogen med olika intressenter och definiera stories och iterationer.
* Skapa kommunikation kring planer och leveranser samt fungera som länk mellan affären, användarna, interna och externa leverantörer och teamet.
* Aktivt följa upp värdet av genomförda leveranser och ansvara för kvaliteten och tillgängligheten i IT-systemen samt efterlevnaden av regelverk.


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Vi söker dig med 5–10 års erfarenhet inom systemförvaltning, gärna från bank- eller finanssektorn, i roller som förvaltare, utvecklare, IT-specialist eller arbetsledare.
* Relevant akademisk examen eller relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT och Beslutsstöd.
* Mycket god kompetens avseende systemförvaltning.
* Mycket goda kunskaper, förståelse och erfarenhet av IT-området
* Flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav.


 Följande erfarenheter och kunskaper är meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från bank- och finanssektorn.
* Erfarenhet av ständig förbättring, agil utveckling (Safe).
* Erfarenhet av arbete som Product Owner.
* Erfarenhet av DataWarehouse, BI-lösningar och analys


 Som person är du drivande, öppen och positiv till förändring. Du är diplomatisk, en bra kommunikatör och skapar effektiva samarbeten. Du söker lösningar, arbetar både strategiskt och operativt, samt är noggrann och samarbetsvillig.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi är ett kompetent och dedikerat team med en öppen dialog. Vi utvecklar oss själva och bankverksamheten och tar stort ansvar för våra leveranser. Du kommer att ha ett brett kontaktnät och arbeta nära olika funktioner inom Länsförsäkringar AB och våra leverantörer. Jag som blir din chef har lång erfarenhet inom bank och försäkring med fokus på IT. Mitt ledarskap bygger på tillit, tillgänglighet och tydliga förväntningar. Jag vill att du trivs på jobbet och har de verktyg och mandat du behöver. Välkommen med din ansökan och bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-30**

title: Product Researcher and Designer
description:
Join our R&D IT team as a Product Researcher / User Experience Designer, where you will be at the forefront of creating intuitive, user-friendly products that meet the needs of our end users. This role is pivotal in identifying business transformation opportunities through research, driving optimization, and unlocking new sources of value creation. With a focus on hypothesis-led, evidence-driven approach to value creation, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive user-centered design and research practices throughout the organization.

**What you’ll do:**  

As a Product Researcher and Designer, you will contribute to the development and execution of a comprehensive user research framework aligned with product and business goals. You will identify key research questions, methodologies, and timelines for research initiatives. Your role will involve conducting qualitative and quantitative user research studies, translating research findings into actionable insights, and designing wireframes, prototypes, and user interfaces. You will also advocate for user needs throughout the product development lifecycle and stay updated on industry trends related to user experience design and research.

**Essential Skills/Experience:**

* Bachelor's or master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience Design, Psychology, or a related field.
* Proven experience (7+ years) in user experience design and research, preferably in an R&D and/or Pharma setting.
* Deep understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices.
* Proficiency in conducting user research studies.
* Experience of UX tools and methods across the full user-centered design process.
* Specialist technical skills in creating information architectures, flows and wireframes, interactive prototypes, moderating usability lab testing and other research methodologies.
* Finely honed visual/ graphic design skills (color, typography, layout, illustration).
* An excellent listener and presenter.

**We believe the following experience is desirable:**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma.
* Experience with data analysis tools and techniques.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and partners.


When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.


At AstraZeneca, we are committed to making a meaningful impact. Our work has a direct impact on patients, transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data.


Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise. Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth.


AstraZeneca offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits, such as extra paid Holiday, Private Medical Benefit, on-site Work Out and much, much more.


Ready to make a difference? Apply now to join our team as a Product Researcher and Designer!


We welcome your application no later than **September 2nd.**
company_description: Build unrivalled capabilities in a place that promotes learning agility and offers development opportunities. We never standstill so you’ll have the chance to constantly grow your abilities.

title: Global project coordinator
description:
Är du en kommunikativ person som trivs med att driva dina egna ansvarsområden och projekt? Har du även ett öga för detaljer och gillar att förmedla information i text och bild? Då har vi en spännande roll för dig!

 **Vad rollen innebär**


I Aleidos MedTech-team arbetar du med att driva och koordinera projekt i nära samarbete med kundens team. Du följer projekten genom hela processen, från planeringsfas till att projektet stängs. Du ingår i ett team av Aleido-kollegor där ni arbetar tätt ihop och alltid hjälps åt för att ge kunden en bra leverans.


Arbetet består bland annat i att:

* Kommunicera med kunden och genomföra delleveranser.
* Ansvara för Aleidos delar av projekten i samråd med kund.
* Driva projektet framåt enligt befintliga processer.
* Planera och följa upp projekten och kommunicera till alla som är inblandade i dessa.
* Skapa och bearbeta information och instruktioner för olika typer av mottagare i form av text och illustrationer.

**Vem du är**


Vi söker dig som:

* Har studerat Service Management, UX, Interaktionsdesigner eller har likvärdig erfarenhet inom projektkoordinering.
* Har kunskap och erfarenhet av Illustrator, InDesign, CMS och XML, detta är meriterande.
* Trivs med att arbeta i team.
* Talar och skriver på både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
* Har du även erfarenhet från MedTech eller Pharma är mer meriterande.


För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är noggrann och strukturerad samt har en mycket god kommunikationsförmåga. Ofta hanterar du flera projekt med olika leveranstider och kontaktpersoner, vilket gör att du behöver kunna koordinera dina leveranser på ett professionellt sätt.

**Vad vi erbjuder**


På Aleido bidrar du till vårt syfte: att överbrygga klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som använder den. Att arbeta tillsammans med människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter breddar vår förståelse för mänskligt beteende. Vi erbjuder en miljö där medarbetarna är i fokus. Där samarbete, framåtanda och dina unika perspektiv värdesätts. Som medarbetare på Aleido kan du vara trygg med att:

* Du är här av en anledning. Varje individ har mycket att bidra med, och vi vill att du ska lyckas.
* Du kommer få den stöttning du behöver för att lyckas, samtidigt som du kommer bli utmanad i att driva din utveckling framåt.
* Vår lärandekultur hjälper oss att bryta ny mark. Med vårt löfte för lärande lovar vi att generöst dela kunskap, skapa möjligheter för lärande och värdera initiativ att lära.
* Vi är öppensinnade och framtidsinriktade. Det innebär att hållbarhet är kärnan i vårt erbjudande, både direkt och indirekt.
* Vi tror på värdet av flexibilitet. På Aleido har vi en progressiv policy för distansarbete, och de flesta kan arbeta på distans regelbundet.

**Vilka vi är**


Aleido är ett internationellt företag med lång tradition av att driva utvecklingen av eftermarknadsinformation och utbildningslösningar. Våra kunder utvecklar komplexa produkter eller system, eller söker kunskap och beredskap för att skapa varaktig förändring, inom en mängd branscher såsom fordon, telekom, industri, järnväg och medicinteknik. Vi är närmare tusen kollegor i fem länder. Tillsammans överbryggar vi klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som är beroende av den – genom att göra det avancerade lätt att förstå.
company_description: Our mission is to bridge the gap between technology and people by making the advanced simply understood.

title: Full-stack Engineer - Physical Meeting Points
description:
**Job ID:** 253783


**Date posted:** 16/08/2024


**Why we will love you**  

  

We are looking for a passionate full-stack engineer who is excited about technology and innovative ways of working and wants to be a part of shaping the future of IKEA!
  

  

Our team is focusing on providing a convenient, inspiring, and fun shopping experience by enhancing the customer journey in the physical IKEA stores worldwide with digital solutions. We are building a winning team with a clear mission and priorities! Come join us!
  

  

You have a growth mindset and a strong motivation to improve as an engineer. You are curious, honest and collaborative. You love solving technical problems and take ownership and pride in what you deliver, both in terms of engineering quality and impact on our customers.
  

  

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it's important for us that you share our values! You can read more about our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.  

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

'- Working in an empowered agile team, participating in agile ceremonies and working closely with all product disciplines (product, engineering, data and UX) to create requirements, solve business needs and deliver customer impact.
  

  

* Develop and maintain modern frontend web applications and cloud-hosted backend services, with involvement in DevOps practices such as observability, monitoring, and infrastructure as code.

  

* Developing high-quality code and applying software best practices like test automation, CI/CD, pair programming and pull request reviews.

  

* Contribute to continuous improvement of our coding standards, experimenting with new technology and participating in knowledge sharing.

  

Your desired skills
  

  

* Experience in building web applications (html, css, javascript)

  

* React frontend framework and Typescript

  

* test automation (jest, cypress)

  

* Experience in designing and building API's using Node and GCP

  

* Using GitHub, GitHub actions,

  

* Worked in agile ways of working (Scrum, Kanban)

  

* Worked with or interest in IaC/Terraform, Devops, Observability and monitoring

  

**Our team within Ikea**  

  

Our team is in the Physical Customer Meeting Points domain. We focus on building the future shopping experience in the store with digital touchpoints. We love to work closely and have a positive impact on our customers worldwide in their shopping journey in the store.
  

  

We build SPAs and microservices in the cloud, that are used for the self-service screens in the stores worldwide. We work with a DevOps mindset, in cross-functional product teams. We always focus on delivering value in small increments with continuous deployments. We listen to feedback, measure with data and continuously improve.
  

  

You will be part of the development of frontend and backend services with best practices, test automation and CI/CD pipelines. Depending on the interest you will focus more on either the backend or frontend. Part of our work is also prototyping new ideas, both individually and across teams (we love prototyping and MVP!). We value sharing sessions and pair programming for learning.
  

  

We work in an environment that encourages your personal growth where learning is a key factor.
  

  

We are a product team with all capabilities in the team – engineering, product, design and data analytics. The foundation in the team is trust and openness. We try new things, learn, and grow together. We collaborate, pair programmes and we have fun together. Great teams build great products.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

This role is based in Malmö, Sweden.
  

  

If you have any questions about the position, please get in touch with hiring manager Martin Sternebring at martin.sternebring@ingka.ikea.com.
  

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to Warren Roach at warren.roach@ingka.com.
  

  

Please note that we will be interviewing continuously.
  

  

We warmly welcome your application!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Lead Technical UI Designer
description:
We are DICE, the award-winning studio based in Stockholm, Sweden, best known for creating the phenomenally successful Battlefield franchise, the Star Wars™: Battlefront franchise, and Mirror's Edge. Our people are the backbone and driving force to our creative products. That's why we're dedicated to providing everyone the chance to express themselves and be their very best as we all work towards a common cause.


We are now looking for a Lead Technical UI Designer to come join us in bringing the user interface of the next Battlefield to life. You will lead a team of Technical UI Designers (4-8). As a service-oriented leader, you will guide your team to build well thought-out features and systems using our proprietary Frostbite engine. You will work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team to ship features to millions of players around the world. You will report to the Studio Experience Design Director.


**Responsibilities:**


* Manage, mentor and support and a team of Technical UI designers (4-8), be part of hiring and onboarding new colleagues and outsourcing partners
* Foster a supportive and learning culture, furthering best practices, improve workflows to allow for quick UI iteration
* Collaborate with UI/UX leads, production, tech leads, and game developers across our AAA production team to align and deliver features following the art direction, gameplay goals, accessibility and technical standards
* Build and evolve the UI component library in engine to create consistency across the product
* Conduct and guide technical and design reviews, deliver constructive feedback and communicate technical constraints, support the team with technical advice and data structuring strategies, discuss technical feasibility and performance impacts with tech leads
* Identify and communicate dependencies, risks and improvements, serve as first POC for new development, help estimate feature work, capture and reduce technical debt
* Set up and maintain a sustainable testing and automation strategy along with subject matter experts
* Build or bugfix features and UI systems depending on project needs

**Qualifications:**


* Experience leading a AAA game production team through a release
* 5+ years of professional game development experience, implementing UI in game engines using visual scripting
* Strong communication skills and a passion for knowledge sharing and improving workflows
* Team player with a strong technical understanding and an eye for details
* An in-depth understanding of (UI/UX) design principles, typography, layout, motion, visual fidelity, input handling, localization, data binding, prototyping and debugging
* Passion for games, accessibility, and developing inclusive player experiences

  

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.
company_addresses: 209 Redwood Shores Parkway Redwood City, CA 94065
company_description: At Electronic Arts, we exist to inspire the world to play.

Våra kunder utvecklar komplexa produkter eller system, eller söker kunskap och beredskap för att skapa varaktig förändring, inom en mängd branscher såsom fordon, telekom, industri, järnväg och medicinteknik. Vi är närmare tusen kollegor i fem länder. Tillsammans överbryggar vi klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som är beroende av den – genom att göra det avancerade lätt att förstå.
company_description: Our mission is to bridge the gap between technology and people by making the advanced simply understood.

title: Tech Designer
description:
We are Pigs Will Fly Studios!
  
We are a new indie studio in Jönköping with big ambitions and a true passion for games. We are working on an exciting new game based on an exclusive IP and are now looking for new employees to join our team. As the studio is newly started, you have a unique opportunity to become part of the core team, to shape the company and really make your mark. Together we are brave, creative and ambitious. And we have fun!
  
  

The role
  
Pigs Will Fly is seeking a Tech designer to join our development team.
  
As a Tech designer at Pigs Will Fly you will collaborate with the programmers as well as with other members of different crafts within the project. you will be responsible for the technical design work by creating, implementing and maintaining tools, systems and other workflows in order to as efficiently as possibly get the design into the code.
  
You will collaborate closely with the Game Director of the project, giving tech and design advice, helping in articulating scoops and establishing estimates and timelines.
  
The project will be conducted using the Unreal 5 development ecosystem, with both blueprints and C++.
  
As part of the team you will have the opportunity to apply a broad skill set. There are many aspects of design to implement: NPC and enemy AI, player weapons and abilities, player locomotion, world interaction, objectives, and UI implementations.
  
As a team we are going to work with an agile structure and mindset, where every member is part of the creative process, so being able to effectively communicate and provide and receive feedback is essential.
  
  

What you'll do
  
  

Help design and prove new features by developing prototypes to experiment with
  
  

Help identify technical pitfalls and challenges in our designs, offering possible solutions or alternatives
  
  

Contribute tool and workflow improvement ideas, especially design tools
  
  

Help design, balance and tweak our gameplay systems
  
  

Work with other disciplines to help align design intent with non-design pipelines and tech
  
  

Selflessly share knowledge with colleagues
  
  

Actively engage and suggest improvements on the way we work
  
  

Required qualifications
  
  

At least 3 years of experience in developing video games as a Tech designer
  
  

Experience using the Unreal 5 development ecosystem and C++
  
  

A good grasp of AA gameplay and systems design, UX design and gameplay mechanics and dynamics
  
  

A good knowledge or familiarity with other game making disciplines such as animation, game physics, 3D Art, etc.
  
  

A good understanding of game mechanics and game feel
  
  

A passion for games
  
  

Excellent knowledge of Swedish and English, both written and spoken
  
  

As a person - you are proactive, flexible and organized, you enjoy collaborating with others and also know how to give and receive constructive feedback
  
  

Bonus qualifications
  
  

Higher education / Bachelor’s Degree in Game Development or equivalent
  
  

Experience developing games for multiple platforms
  
  

Shipped at least 1 AA game
  
  

Having your own released games or side projects
  
  

Knowledge of agile workflows and kanban
  
  

What we offer
  
  

Hands-on production environment with an emphasis on singleplayer games
  
  

Early adoption of new technology, allowing for plenty of room for personal growth and learning new skills
  
  

Occupational pension
  
  

Health benefits
  
  

An office located in a truly unique building in central Jönköping
  
  

A friendly and inclusive work place centered around fun and creativity
  
  

Application details
  
We are following the policy of office first. However, a hybrid work model is also in the works to make it possible for people to work some days each week from home, and also to make commuting to Jönköping easier from other cities in the region.
  
  

During the recruitment process, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities. We look forward to review applications and will be interviewing candidates continuously until the position has been filled.
  
  

**Location:** Jönköping (Primarily on-site)
  
**Start:** ASAP 2024
  
**Form of Employment:** We offer you a permanent full-time position, which starts with a probationary period.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**Do you want to design experiences and bring creative, user-centered ideas to life for world class clients?** 




  






 We are Twain Studios - an experience design studio in Stockholm. We define, design, and build transformative experiences across all brand touchpoints. 
 




  






 We help large companies innovate and create. We believe in simple solutions to complex problems. Doing things a little bit differently. And having fun doing it. At Twain, the output of every person matters. Our team is a group of curated individuals with unique strengths. Some principles we value are; speed, user focus, collaboration, curiosity, and ownership.
 




  





**Right now we are looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer to join one of our largest design engagements with a multinational client.** 




  





**What will you do?** 




  




* Work on end-to-end UX/UI projects - from initial research through design and handover to developers
* Conduct research to understand user needs and identify insights and pain points
* Solve complex problems and translate requirements and needs into concepts, wireframes and prototypes
* Produce high-fidelity designs and facilitate hand-over to external developers through agile methodologies and ceremonies
* Contribute and help maintain design systems



  





**Who are you?** 




  




* A designer with at least 3 years of professional experience at a UX/UI agency or within a product team
* Very strong visual skills that translate into polished and consistent user interfaces
* Very strong proficiency within Figma
* Relevant degree and experience from user-focused agile design processes
* A service minded person who understands the needs and realities of the client and the user, and has the ability to communicate your ideas and insights to internal and external stakeholders
* Someone with a ‘here to help’ attitude, a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details who loves collaborating with others, both within the team and on the client side
* Experience from design systems and creating tokenized designs - including software like Tokens Studio, Storybook or similar is of merit



  





**Who are we?** 



* A young agency with world class clients right from the get-go, founded by experienced digital professionals
* A supportive, collaborative environment where we help each other grow and learn
* A flexible environment where you set your own schedule around your responsibilities. We trust you.
* Twain is an equal opportunity employer, you are welcome at Twain for who you are. We believe that the more perspectives we have represented at our office, the more we will all thrive and grow.

title: UX/UI Delivery Lead
description:
**Do you want to help bring creative, user-centered digital experiences to life for world class clients?** 




  






 We are Twain Studios - an experience design studio in Stockholm. We define, design, and build transformative experiences across all brand touchpoints. 
 




  






 We help large companies innovate and create. We believe in simple solutions to complex problems. Doing things a little bit differently. And having fun doing it. At Twain, the output of every person matters. Our team is a group of curated individuals with unique strengths. Some principles we value are; energy, an eye for detail, collaboration, speed, curiosity, respect, and ownership.
 




  





**Right now we are looking for a UX/UI Delivery Lead (Project Manager) for one of our largest UX/UI engagements with a multinational client.** 




  





**What will you do?** 




  




* Manage studio deliveries as an agile project manager - shipping digital products and services end-to-end with partners
* Be the bridge between the client, our team of strategists and designers and external developers - You will use your skills to make sure that everyone strives towards the same goal
* You will be part of all phases of strategy and design - all the way from understanding the user through to the final product
* Ensure that our team has everything they need to deliver large, complex projects as well as smaller, fast-paced assignments - help them uncover and unblock any issues along the way
* Attend and sometimes lead agile ceremonies - helping manage timelines and the backlog together with product owners on the client side
* Spread the love - coach and motivate your project team to do great work - find areas of improvement and suggest changes to processes accordingly - to constantly strengthen the collaborative culture at Twain



  





**Who are you?** 




  




* A Product Owner, Digital Project Manager or similar with at least three years of professional experience at another agency or product team
* A social and outgoing person who is comfortable interacting with clients and team members, and can communicate ideas and rationale behind designs and decisions
* Energetic and engaging - you enjoy motivating and inspiring others to do their best work
* An organized and structured person who makes sure things are done on time, who loves collaborating with others, both within the team and on the client side
* Full professional English proficiency is a must as well as being based in Stockholm
* CRO experience is of merit
* Any experience in agile methodologies like Scrum or SAFe is of merit



  





**Who are we?** 




  




* A young agency with world-class clients right from the get-go, founded by experienced digital professionals
* A supportive, collaborative environment where we help each other grow and learn
* A flexible environment where you set your schedule around your responsibilities. We trust you.
* Twain is an equal opportunity employer, you are welcome at Twain for who you are. We believe that the more perspectives we have represented at our office, the more we will all thrive and grow.

title: UX Designer sökes
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker konsultkollegor inom UX med hjärtat på rätt ställe och som vill vara med oss på resan att designa för en bättre framtid.
   

  

 Rollen:
   

  

 Vi söker UX designers som redan har några års konsulterfarenhet och som nu vill komma till ett bolag med likasinnade och ödmjuka människor som jobbar med kunder i världsklass.
   

  

 Uppdragen varierar och du är alltid med och bestämmer ditt nästa uppdrag. Vi kommer bland annat ge dig utmaningar och en individuell plan för din karriär utöver kollektivavtal och en konkurrenskraftig lön.
   

  

 Kravspecifikation:
   

  

* Gärna en examen inom området.
* Minst fem års praktisk arbetserfarenhet.
* Du bor i Stockholm eller i närheten av huvudstaden.
* Du har jobbat med spännande kunder inom tex. bank, försäkring, retail, produktbolag.
* Du får gärna ha koll på hela UX-processen men det är inget krav.
* Du bemästrar flertalet metoder för att leda workshops och du är duktig på att sammanfatta och dokumentera insikter på ett enkelt sätt.
* Du kan jobba med olika prototypverktyg och kan anpassa dig efter kundens önskemål, Figma eller liknande.
* Du har goda kunskaper och tidigare erfarenheter av arbete med digital tillgänglighet och har självklart koll på det nya direktivet som kommer 2025.

title: Product Designer – Travel Platforms (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****This role is based in Bangkok, Thailand****
 We believe in making it easier for everyone to experience the world.
   

  

 The interactive experience across travel is spectacularly shifting, and our Product Design team is passionate about evolving our innovative experience to ensure Agoda is the best place for guests to book accommodations and our hotels have the best platform to showcase their properties. Our customers deserve experiences that cultivate their loyalty and make it easier to engage with all that is magnificent about Agoda!
   

  

 As a Product Designer, you will be joining a team that’s passionate about systematic design, organization, and building the most scalable solutions for our partners and stakeholders. We’re a large, diverse team and look forward to a new strong team player.
   

  

**What’s product design like at Agoda?**
 Typically, product designers at Agoda work alongside a product manager, web and app engineers, and cross-functional partners. Together they drive their own part of Agoda, deliver solutions to problems and get feedback directly from customers and internal partners.
   

  

****Get to Know our Team:****
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok, Thailand. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand customer problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skillset, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. The opportunity and timing are now if you wish to come into a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and unlock the world for our global community of travelers.
   

  

****In this Role, you’ll get to:****
* Help design the future of Agoda. We are looking for thoughtful, extremely talented designers (and design thinkers) to join our team and help us fundamentally shape the vision of our product. We want you to play a major role in building a design driven culture
* We only scratched the surface. The online travel industry is extremely dynamic and competitive space. Our aim is to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment
* Work in Asia’s most vibrant city. Bangkok provides a setting like no other: edgy, luxurious, impossibly sensorial, endlessly layered. The perfect junction of a globally-minded career and the heart of Asian travel. You will learn and expand your skills as a designer by applying your craft


****What you’ll Need to Succeed:****
* A product designer with strategic design background, hybrid IXD / VD toolkit
* Can think at all layers, from product design, to interaction, to beautiful pixels
* Must have previous exposure to Agile environment
* Demonstrated success in designing and delivering compelling products in a high growth, fast pace rapidly changing environment that delight users
* Solid understanding of grid systems, typography, web and mobile interface trends
* Great ownership and collaborative mindset to ship products
* Data-driven designer with great A/B Testing and research knowledge
* You’re more concerned with the ‘why’ than the ‘how’
* 4+ years of full-time experience as a UX/Interaction designer for digital or web-based products; in-house designer experience highly preferred
* Proficient in creating wireframes, UX design tools and prototyping (e.g., Sketch, Framer, InVision, Adobe design tools, etc.)
* A strong portfolio of work that demonstrate your design thinking, process, and solutions as it relates to web-based products and mobile applications
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills in English
* Bachelor’s degree in human-computer interaction (HCI), Graphic Design, or related design discipline


 By applying to this job, you agree that Agoda may process your personal data in accordance with Agoda applicants privacy statement. (link to https://careersatagoda.com/privacy-statement/)
   

  

 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Lead Technical UI Designer
description:
We are DICE, the award-winning studio based in Stockholm, Sweden, best known for creating the phenomenally successful Battlefield franchise, the Star Wars™: Battlefront franchise, and Mirror's Edge. Our people are the backbone and driving force to our creative products. That's why we're dedicated to providing everyone the chance to express themselves and be their very best as we all work towards a common cause.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Lead Technical UI Designer to come join us in bringing the user interface of the next Battlefield to life. You will lead a team of Technical UI Designers (4-8). As a service-oriented leader, you will guide your team to build well thought-out features and systems using our proprietary Frostbite engine. You will work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team to ship features to millions of players around the world. You will report to the Studio Experience Design Director.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage, mentor and support and a team of Technical UI designers (4-8), be part of hiring and onboarding new colleagues and outsourcing partners
* Foster a supportive and learning culture, furthering best practices, improve workflows to allow for quick UI iteration
* Collaborate with UI/UX leads, production, tech leads, and game developers across our AAA production team to align and deliver features following the art direction, gameplay goals, accessibility and technical standards
* Build and evolve the UI component library in engine to create consistency across the product
* Conduct and guide technical and design reviews, deliver constructive feedback and communicate technical constraints, support the team with technical advice and data structuring strategies, discuss technical feasibility and performance impacts with tech leads
* Identify and communicate dependencies, risks and improvements, serve as first POC for new development, help estimate feature work, capture and reduce technical debt
* Set up and maintain a sustainable testing and automation strategy along with subject matter experts
* Build or bugfix features and UI systems depending on project needs


**Qualifications**
* Experience leading a AAA game production team through a release
* 5+ years of professional game development experience, implementing UI in game engines using visual scripting
* Strong communication skills and a passion for knowledge sharing and improving workflows
* Team player with a strong technical understanding and an eye for details
* An in-depth understanding of (UI/UX) design principles, typography, layout, motion, visual fidelity, input handling, localization, data binding, prototyping and debugging
* Passion for games, accessibility, and developing inclusive player experiences

title: Digital Product Manager
description:
**Digital Product Manager på B3 Business Transformation**
 Vi fortsätter att växa och söker nu både seniora och juniora konsulter med några års relevant erfarenhet till vårt team med digitala product managers, produktägare, projektledare och strateger. Vill du utvecklas och inspireras i en miljö med erfarna, trevliga och prestigelösa kollegor i spännande uppdrag? Vi försöker leva som vi lär genom att kultur, utveckling och samarbete i teamet och bolaget med ett agilt och självorganiserande mindset som baseras på nyfikenhet, lust och utbyte av erfarenheter.
   

  

 Hos oss får du förtroende och ansvar för arbeta på det sätt du tycker är bäst för det aktuella uppdraget/kunden och ditt liv i övrigt med familj, intressen etc, samtidigt som du har alla möjligheter att bolla med och få stöd av erfarna kollegor som verkligen gillar att hjälpas åt. B3 kom 2021 trea i Great Place To Works årliga undersökning för klassen bästa stora arbetsplatserna i Sverige, med 94% som tycker B3 är en bra arbetsplats!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som digital product manager kommer du arbeta med både mindre och stora komplexa projekt eller agila strömmar hos välkända kunder. Du får tillsammans med ett team ta ansvar för att leverera meningsfulla och hållbara digitala produkter utifrån datadriven kunskap. Det handlar främst om initiativ som syftar till att utveckla det digitala kundmötet och se till att processer och system finns på baksidan stödjer förflyttningen. Ofta ingår även i uppdragen att stötta kundens organisation och leda förändring mot att jobba effektivt och modernt med agila metoder för att hantera vision, roadmap, backlog etc.
   

  

 Du arbetar antingen som ledande konsult i kundens organisation, som ledare av ett team från B3 i ett leveransåtagande eller som interimskonsult i linjeroller som Digital Product manager, Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Developer, CDO, CTO. Lite mer juniora konsulter tror vi utvecklas mest om de får jobba nära tillsammans med mer erfarna kollegor i början tills man är mogen att ta ett eget större ansvar.
   

  

**Vi tror att du**
* Har genuint intresse för digitala förändringsprojekt och digitalisering och drivas av att lösa problem för produkternas användare eller kunder
* Har en god förståelse för det digitala kundmötet, affär, design/UX, teknik och moderna agila arbetssätt
* Är van att kommunicera och förankra med interna och externa stakeholders
* Kan kombinera strategiska långsiktiga perspektiv med operativ initiativförmåga
* Tar eget initiativ och ansvar för att driva uppdrag som utmanar dig på din nivå
* Jobbar strukturerat med ett analytiskt sinnelag
* Nyfiket lyssnar på dina kunder, kollegor och leverantörskontakter och argumenterar för de bästa lösningarna på ett prestigelöst sätt
* Vill vara delaktig i den fortsatta utvecklingen av B3 Business Transformation för att skapa den bästa arbetsplatsen för dig och dina kollegor


**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av**
* Några år som konsult inom management, product management, projektledning och/eller erfarenhet av motsvarande från ledande digital linjeroll eller interimskonsult. Detta är en aspekt som prioriteras i processen.
* Att leda agila digitala projekt och/eller agila produkt-team som exempelvis större webbprojekt, digital självservice, digital försäljning/growth eller implementering av CRM, contact center och kundservice
* Några produkter och plattformar för kunddata som DXP, CMS, CRM, Marketing, Analytics, BI mm
* Arbete på svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift


**Det är toppen om du även har erfarenhet av**
* Att leda agil transformation för att etablera effektiva team och arbetssätt
* Praktiskt arbete inom skalade agila ramverk som tex SAFE.
* En master inom ekonomi, civilingenjör eller motsvarande


*B3 Business Transformation skapar framtidens kundmöte och vårt fokus är att få saker att hända på riktigt. Ofta handlar det om att stärka den digitala konkurrenskraften hos våra kunder genom att få till beslut och leda utveckling av nya digitala initiativ men även att förbättra den digital förmågan och etablera moderna arbetssätt.*
*Vi är ett av specialistbolagen inom B3 inriktade på strategi och agil ledning utifrån framtidens kundmöte i en digital värld. Vi arbetar med välkända kunder där det digitala kundmötet är av avgörande betydelse. Det ställer krav på ett nära samarbete med kunden, hög ambition och kraft att leda förändringen i mål.*

title: Digital Customer Insights Lead
description:
As the Digital Customer Insights Lead, you will play a key role in ensuring that Qualtrics customer insights across our range of products, experiences and markets is gathered, analysed, and shared with stakeholders in ways that support our UX and UI programme of continuous enhancements to improve the user experience.
   

  

**Please note the closing date for applications is : Sunday 1st September**
**About The Job**
 As a customer experience expert and key proponent for the customer in the digital space, your primary responsibility will be to bring to life the user experience, based on customer feedback, with our DX Team and other stakeholders and deliver strategic insights appropriately through thorough regular analysis and reporting.
   

  

 Using your deep understanding of the user experience you will regularly report customer feedback insights, contextualising your findings with actionable recommendations for improvement. To do this, you’ll ensure that customer insight can be effectively collated and consumed by our stakeholders at all levels.
   

  

 You will work closely with your colleagues in Digital Research to provide rounded insight that enables deep understanding and appropriate prioritisation of the issues and opportunities found, and to look for new ways to join customer feedback up with other sources of insight (eg user research, analytics) to drive customer satisfaction improvements through actionable insights and recommendations. Therefore, a key stakeholder group is the agile teams – DX Leads, UX and UI Designers, and Product Management will all benefit from regular updates and collaboration with you.
   

  

 You will be heavily involved in managing, developing and iterating the reporting from Qualtrics, using your ability to understand the complex data architecture systems to plan and build suitable dashboards to help us get the most out of the tool. Your regular interaction with DX Leads, UX and UI Designers, our colleagues in Digital Product, and other senior team members in the Architecture and Analytics teams, as well as our implementation partner, ensures the tool is robustly built and integrated. Your understanding of customer feedback tools, quantitative research methodologies, and how best to use the insights to drive customer engagement improvements will see you identify useful new functionality and how best to incorporate this into existing processes and ways of working. Your drive to contribute to improving the user experience will see you uncover more opportunities for insights (e.g. related to usability testing findings, A/B or optimisation test results) as well as broadening and enhancing the range of insights already covered.
   

  

 You’ll be regularly reviewing processes and methods to keep TUI operating at ‘best in class’ level, and looking for new ways of driving engagement with all customer feedback insights you uncover, tailoring your approach to delivery and sharing to have the most impact.
   

  

 You have demonstrable people management experience to line manage, coach, develop and performance manage the Digital Customer Insights Executive.
   

  

 Your passion for the customer and deep understanding of the insight you provide will be key attributes in how you engage with and influence stakeholders to achieve customer-centric outcomes from the information at your disposal.
   

  

**About You**
* Passion for continually analysing and improving the customer experience and keeping up to date with best-in-class and emerging methods and processes
* A background in quantitative user research methodologies and reporting is beneficial
* Experience working in a complex, fast-moving, and international Ecommerce environment
* Understanding of customer feedback tools implementation is beneficial
* Strong interpersonal skills to work with senior internal stakeholders and external suppliers
* Great communication skills to deliver insight effectively at all levels
* Strong organisation and prioritisation skills, analytical and strong attention to detail
* Pragmatic, collaborative and constructive approach to delivering value
* Experience of managing and developing a small team
* Proven ability to deliver quality outputs independently to priorities and agreed timelines


**About Our Offer**
* Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
* Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
* Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.
* Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA
   

  

 If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk
   

  

 We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Role: Solution Architect** 




**Duration: Contract** 




**Location: Solna, Sweden** 




  





 We are looking for a Solutions Architect who can architect, design, develop and maintain software applications (or able to delegate parts thereof) .Previous experience working with data-centric full-stack applications is essential. You will work as part of a Scrum team and interact with business users to understand the requirements.
 



  





**Must-requirement:** 



* Experience with Microsoft Azure services
* Experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps
* Experience with microservice architecture
* Experience with building frontend and backend applications that compose over REST APIs and various types of data sources (SQL, CSV, JSON)
* Experience with building software using SOLID principles



**Should requirements:** 



* Experience working with PySpark, Databrick and Power BI
* Frontend developments skills
* Experience in requirement processes for UI or UX
* Experience in agile way of working (SCRUM)

title: Product Owner to Scania Customer Digitalization
description:
Scania is taking the lead in the shift to sustainable transports, and we are looking for a passionate and innovative Product Owner to join our team in digital service development.
   

  

 As our customers transition to more sustainable transport solutions, they need more and more support through digital services in their daily operations. Together with competent colleagues, you will explore and find solutions to our customers' problems and challenges.
   

  

**Your tasks**
 Your work as a Product Owner will be done in close collaboration with our fantastic development teams where you ensure that they have a suitable and prioritized backlog to work with, always with the customer in focus. You will work with services such as route and transport planning, driving and rest times and other functions aimed at helping customers plan, implement and optimize their daily transport operations.
   

  

 You will be part of a product management team that has joint responsibility for the product vision, roadmap and finding business opportunities. You will also be responsible for the team's roadmap and vision. Here, you will work closely with product managers, service designers, UX designers, and other product owners to ensure a holistic view of our customers' needs.
   

  

**Your profile**
**Role**
 We want you to have experience of the role of product owner, team leader or similar for a few years in an agile software context in the connected vehicle area. We also believe that you are:
   

  

* Good at interacting with customers, always seeing their needs.
* A brave person who doesn't focus on obstacles but instead on how you can learn from and overcome them.
* Curious and open to see things from different perspectives.
* Analytical and data driven able to engage in technical discussions.
* A great communicator.


**How We Work**
 Scania's culture is characterized by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. We value freedom and creativity and prefer to work in autonomous cross-functional development teams that take full responsibility for our services. We encourage an environment where it is fully accepted to make mistakes, learn and try again.
   

  

 We work in an exciting multicultural environment with English as language. We are convinced that a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of inspiring work environments and first-class services.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As an employee at Scania, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include bonus, staff car, occupational pension and flexible working hours and location which allow for a good work-life balance.
   

  

**Further information**
 For more information, please contact Eduardo Abrigo, Acting Head of Vehicle and Data ,eduardo.abrigo@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 We are looking forward to receiving your application not later than August 29, 2024. Selections will be made continuously throughout the application period.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*Kindly notice that a background check might be conducted for the position.*

title: Ekonom med inriktning mot utbildningsekonomi
description:
Göteborgs universitet möter samhällets utmaningar med mångsidig kunskap. 56 000 studenter och 6 600 medarbetare gör universitetet till en stor och inspirerande arbetsplats. Stark forskning och attraktiva utbildningar lockar forskare och studenter från hela världen. Med ny kunskap och nya perspektiv bidrar Göteborgs universitet till en bättre framtid.


*Institutionen för Pedagogik, kommunikation och lärande* *(IPKL) är en del av den Utbildningsvetenskapliga fakulteten vid Göteborgs universitet. Vid institutionen bedrivs omfattande och internationellt ledande forskning om barns och ungdomars livsvillkor, om förskolan och barns lärande, om digitaliseringens konsekvenser för skola och utbildning liksom om vuxnas lärande i arbetsliv och andra sammanhang. Institutionen bedriver utbildning på grund-, avancerad och forskarnivå och det mest omfattande uppdraget är undervisning inom förskollärarprogrammet och grundlärarprogrammet med inriktning mot arbete i fritidshem.*


**Arbetsuppgifter**



Vill du arbeta med varierade och stimulerande arbetsuppgifter i en spännande miljö och bli en del av vår administrativa grupp på institutionen? Då är detta en möjlighet för dig!



Verksamhetsstödet vid institutionen ansvarar för det samlade administrativa stödet till lärare, forskare och ledning. Vi arbetar inom områdena ekonomi, kommunikation, utbildning, förvaltning, IT och HR. Vi söker nu en ny kollega inom ekonomiområdet.



Som ekonom kommer din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift vara att ansvara för utbildningsekonomin på institutionen. Det innefattar följande arbetsuppgifter:


* Ansvar för att beräkna hur många timmar som kan läggas ut på våra kurser och uppdatera kursbudget i tjänsteplaneringsverktyget Retendo
* Studentprognoser och löpande uppföljningar
* Handläggning av institutionens utbildningsuppdrag och utbildningsprojekt – allt från att hjälpa till med offert/kalkyl till att skriva avtal, följa upp, göra prognoser och redovisningar.
* Inköp kopplat till utbildningen t.ex. till utbildningskonferenser, böcker och internköp av utbildningstjänster.
* Fakturering t.ex. när våra lärare undervisar på andra institutioner eller lärosäten
* Resebokningar och support vid reseräkningar åt våra lärare
* Bistå institutionsledningen med diverse underlag t.ex. till utvärdering av utbildningsprogram


Även andra arbetsuppgifter inom verksamhetsstödets ansvarsområde kan komma att ingå i anställningen.



Som ekonom ingår du i institutionens verksamhetsstöd och samarbetar med såväl kollegor inom stödet som kursledare, studierektorer och övriga ledningspersoner. Samarbete sker också med medarbetare vid andra institutioner, fakulteten och universitetet.


**Kvalifikationer**



Vi söker dig som har en akademisk examen inom ekonomi eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i Officepaketet, särskilt Excel. Du har god datorvana, sätter dig snabbt in i och arbetar effektivt i digitala system. Du uttrycker dig mycket väl i såväl tal som skrift både på svenska och engelska.



Erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter, företrädesvis från högskola/universitet, är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet av arbete i verktygen Agresso, Panorama/Hypergene, Datalagret, Primula, Ladok, Retendo, NyA och Teams.



Som person söker vi dig som är strukturerad, noggrann, flexibel, kommunikativ, lätt att samarbeta med och analytisk. Du har också ett driv att vilja utveckla och effektivisera ekonomiska processer. Du arbetar självständigt i din roll och ansvarar för hur du lägger upp ditt arbete för att kunna prestera inom deadlines.



I urvalsförfarandet kommer arbetsgivaren främst att beakta den som efter en helhetsbedömning kan anses ha de bästa förutsättningarna att genomföra ovan angivna arbetsuppgifter. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


**Övrigt**



Här finns goda möjligheter till egen utveckling och förmånliga arbetsvillkor. Verksamheten arbetar aktivt för en trivsam arbetsmiljö där medarbetare ges möjlighet till delaktighet.


**Anställning**



Anställningen är tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering tills vidare vid institutionen för pedagogik, kommunikation och lärande. Tillträde så snart som möjligt, enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.


**Tillsättningsförfarande**



Anställningsprocessen innefattar såväl intervju som ett praktiskt test i Excel.


**Kontaktuppgifter för anställningen**



Har du frågor om anställningen är du välkommen att kontakta



Kristin Martinsson, administrativ chef, kristin.martinsson@gu.se, 0766-182344



Mattias Zackrisson, controller, mattias.zackrisson@gu.se, 0766-184200


**Fackliga organisationer**



Fackliga företrädare vid Göteborgs universitet hittar du här: https://www.gu.se/om-universitetet/jobba-hos-oss/hjalp-for-sokande


**Ansökan**



Du söker anställningen via Göteborgs universitets rekryteringsportal genom att klicka på knappen "Ansök". Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.


**Ansökan ska vara inkommen senast**: 2024-09-09

  


Universitetet arbetar aktivt för en arbetsmiljö med jämställda förhållanden och sätter värde på de kvalitéer mångfald tillför verksamheten.
  

  

Universitetet tillämpar individuell lönesättning.
  

  

Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter är universitetet skyldigt att förvara ansökningshandlingar i två år efter tillsättningsbeslutet. Om du som sökande till en anställning särskilt begär tillbaka dina handlingar återsänds de när de två åren har förflutit, i annat fall kommer de att gallras ut.
  

  

Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Göteborgs universitet anlitar upphandlad annonsbyrå i samband med rekrytering av personal. Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.

title: Lead Data Engineer till Aotektet Hjärtat
description:
**Start****18-09-2024****Duration****10-12 months**
  
emagine söker nu en lead data engineer till apotektet hjärtat.


Svara med Mappning mot krav, cv, motivering och pris


**Uppdragets omfattning**  

  

Omfattningen av uppdraget är 100 %


Ort: Stockholm  

Period 2024-09-09 - 2025-05-30


Uppdragsbeskrivning
Som Lead Data Developer kommer du att ha en ledande roll i att utveckla datalösningar och applikationer som levererar värde till verksamheten. Du kommer att ta den övergripande ledningen för att designa, utveckla och underhålla dataprodukter och datatillgångar som krävs för att leverera affärsvärde.


Du arbetar tillsammans med produktägare och potentiella datanvändare för att förstå vad som ska byggas och samarbetar nära med verksamheten för att identifiera möjligheter att använda data för att föreslå lösningar för effektivt beslutsfattande. Det inkluderar också att designa eller koda/bygga experiment för att sammanfoga, hantera, förhöra och extrahera data för att leverera skräddarsydda rapporter och analyser till kollegor, kunder eller hela organisationen.


Du kommer att vara en del av och vägleda, styra och coacha ett team av data engineers och data developers. Du kommer att arbeta nära källsystemen för att identifiera och hämta rätt data till dataplattformen samt bygga och skala produktionen av datapipelines och leverans av dataprodukter.

 **Profil & Meriter**


Profil & Meriter
Vi söker dig med minst 5 års erfarnhet och följande kunskapsområden:

* Datamodelleringstekniker
* Databassystem, warehousing och distributed computing
* Programmering (phyton, SQL, data processing framework (Pandas etc)
* Data Pipeline Orchestration Tool (Azure, DataBricks, DBT)
* GIT and CI/CD Pipelines
* Konsumtion av RestAPI:er och Kafka
* Meriterande om du har bakgrund från mjukvaruutveckling med intresse för data och anlaytics.

  
Anders Wildelv
Business Manager

+46 732644997

title: Solutions Engineer (Data Engineer, DS/ML, DWH Analytics, Cloud)
description:
**Req ID FEQ425R47**



At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate how our Databricks Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!



Reporting to Senior Manager, Field Engineering.


**We have two positions - one is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and the other in Copenhagen, Denmark.**


**The impact you will have:**


* Form successful relationships with clients throughout your assigned territory to provide technical and business value in collaboration with an Account Executive and a Senior Solutions Architect.
* Gain excitement from clients about Databricks through hands-on evaluation and Spark programming, integrating with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications.
* Contribute to building the Databricks technical through engagement at workshops, seminars, and meet-ups.
* Become a Big Data Analytics advisor on aspects of architecture and design.
* Support your customers by authoring reference architectures, how-tos, and demo applications.
* Develop both technically and in the pre-sales aspect with the goal of becoming an independently operating Solutions Architect.


**What we look for:**


* Experience, technical customer-facing and with a background in Data Science/GenAI/ML or Data Engineering and/or Data Warehousing.
* Fluent in written and spoken languages, in the countries are:
	+ Based in Stockholm, Sweden will speak fluent English, with Swedish as an advantage.
	+ Based In Copenhagen, Denmark will be fluent in Danish and English
* Any experience of Pre-sales or post-sales experience working with external clients
* Familiarity working with clients, creating a narrative, answering customer questions, aligning the agenda with important interests, and achieving tangible outcomes.
* To develop a trusted advisor skillset, the candidate must be able to independently deliver a technical proposition, identify the customer's pain points, and explain important areas for business value.
* Code in a core programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Knowledgeable in a core Big Data Analytics domain with some exposure to advanced proofs-of-concept and an understanding of a major public cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Experience diving deeper into solution architecture and design.
* The role requires travel to customer sites in the Nordic region. Travelling approx. 20-30% of the time
* Nice to have: Databricks Certification


**Benefits**


* Private Medical Insurance
* Vision Reimbursement
* Life, accident and disability coverage
* Pension Plan
* Equity awards
* Enhanced Parental Leaves
* Fitness reimbursement
* Annual career development fund
* Home office & work headphones reimbursement
* Business travel accident insurance
* Mental wellness resources
* Employee referral bonus

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**
company_description: Databricks, the data and AI company, helps data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

title: Senior Software Engineer within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 900 employees in several countries.


At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.


**The Position**

Are you an experienced frontend software engineer with deep experience in frontend development? Do you want write code that will directly impact the health and well-being of millions? Do you want to want to contribute to a modern, device-agnostic application framework being built from the ground up? If so, we have a fantastic opportunity for you to become a member of our Cambio Application Framework team.


We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining our frontend application framework using modern web technologies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create modular, scalable, and robust solutions that integrate seamlessly with our backend systems.


As a senior software engineer in the CAF team, you will be part of an agile team working to transform how we develop the Nordic’s leading electronic health record. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create modular, scalable, and robust solutions that integrate seamlessly with our backend-for-frontend framework and APIs.


**About you**


To thrive in this role, you are a person with excellent communication and collaboration skills, naturally inclined to support others and engage with consumer teams. You are a social team member who values teamwork and adapts well to various working styles, always contributing to the team’s collaborative spirit.  

  



**Requirements**


* 5+ years of experience in frontend development with a strong understanding of modern web technologies.
* Proven experience in building complex web applications, beyond just simple pages.
* Deep expertise in at least one frontend framework, with high-level knowledge of others.
* Proficiency in TypeScript
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to think broadly about how solutions fit into the overall architecture and long-term goals.
* Communicates fluently in both spoken and written English

**It’s a bonus if you have**

* Experience with Java. With a strong understanding of native JavaScript, Web Components, and modern CSS techniques.
* Experience with CI/CD, development tooling, Electron, and Node.js
* Experience with Scrum or Kanban, as we practice agile methodologies

**Place of employment:** Linköping or Stockholm


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you will work at the office, and which you work from home.


**Scope**: Full time


**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden. We will ask for verification during the process.

**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

description:

För dessa roller söker vi dig som är resultatinriktad och har god analytisk förmåga. Vidare har du en god kommunikationsförmåga och samarbetar på ett bra och konstruktivt sätt med såväl kollegor som uppdragsgivare.
