title: Email marketing automation specialist
description:
**Vill du vara med och revolutionera eventbranschen som en del av vårt kreativa digitala team?** Är du en passionerad digital marknadsförare som älskar att skapa tillväxt genom smarta och effektiva e-mailkampanjer? Då kan du vara den vi letar efter!


I en värld där tekniken ständigt förändras, är det mänskliga mötet viktigare än någonsin. På Easyfairs vet vi att inget slår känslan av att vara där – att uppleva ett event live, med alla sinnen. Det är därför vi kombinerar den senaste tekniken med oförglömliga upplevelser för att skapa event i världsklass.


Vi har stora planer för framtiden! Easyfairs har vuxit från en idé 2004 till att bli en av världens topp 11-eventarrangörer. Nu letar vi efter en skicklig **Email marketing automation specialist** som vill vara med och driva vår fortsatta tillväxtresa. I denna roll kommer du att jobba med några av Nordens mest spännande event som Comic Con, FFCR, Elmässan, SETT, Personal & Chef, och många fler.

**Din roll som Email marketing automation specialist**  

Som vår nya Email marketing automation specialist blir du hjärnan bakom våra e-mailkampanjer i Norden. Du kommer att arbeta hands-on i Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) med allt från att sätta upp smarta, automatiserade kundresor till att utveckla snygga och responsiva mallar. Du kommer även att A/B-testa och optimera våra strategier för att säkerställa att vi når rätt personer, vid rätt tidpunkt, med rätt budskap.

**I vår team kommer du att:**

* Skapa högpresterande e-mailkampanjer som levererar fantastiska resultat.
* Maximera användningen av Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Driva den strategiska utvecklingen och automatiseringen av våra e-mailprocesser.
* Förbättra effektiviteten i våra kampanjer genom smart marketing automation.

**Din vardag kommer att innebära:**

* Design och implementering av effektiva strategier för e-mail och marketing automation.
* Skapande av responsiva e-mailmallar enligt bästa praxis och varumärkesriktlinjer.
* Genomförande av A/B-tester för att kontinuerligt optimera kampanjerna.
* Ge utbildning och support till kollegor i Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Säkerställande av optimal kampanjplanering och ledning av e-mails bästa praxis.
* Optimering av konverteringsfrekvenser för registreringar och besökare via e-mailkanaler.
* Leverera insiktsfull rapportering och benchmarking för våra e-mailkampanjer.

**Vem är du?**

* Du har 3-5 års erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring och har framgångsrikt implementerat e-mailkampanjer och kundresor.
* Du har en högre utbildning inom digital marknadsföring eller digital teknik.
* Du är van vid att jobba med Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller liknande plattformar för marketing automation.
* Du har erfarenhet av Litmus eller liknande verktyg för att testa och analysera e-mailkampanjer.
* Du är digitalt driven, organiserad, detaljorienterad, och en god kommunikatör.
* Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska. Kunskaper i finska eller danska är ett plus.

**Vad Easyfairs kan erbjuda dig**  

Easyfairs är ett dynamiskt och energifyllt företag med över 600 teammedlemmar runt om i Europa. Hos oss är det inte bara erfarenhet som räknas, utan vi värderar potential och vilja att växa ännu högre. Vi erbjuder dig en spännande resa med massor av utvecklingsmöjligheter i en kreativ och fartfylld miljö. Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team!


Läs mer: https://www.easyfairs.com/

**Ansök nu!** Vår rekryteringsprocess pågår löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan! Vänligen bifoga ditt CV och personliga brev på engelska - då kandidater i processen även intervjuas av vårt HQ i Bryssel.

title: Senior Automation Engineer
description:
Senior Automation Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Sweden


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Description:** Senior Automation Engineer

  


We are a committed team that helps our customers adapt to a sustainable future and new requirements. Our projects vary from "Greenfield" to "Brownfield". At us, we work closely together, cross-functionally as well as in our own automation projects and consulting assignments. You mainly work together with colleagues who are project managers, process engineers and of course electrical and automation engineers.

  


In this role, you will work with our customers in the Nordic food and/or pharmaceutical industry in the Öresund region. You will focus on:

  


* SatLine
* ABB 800xA
* Commissioning
* Troubleshooting
* Process and machine safety (PL/SIL)

  




It is of course an advantage if you also want and can work with other systems such as Siemens TIA Portal, WinCC and Schneider / Aveva automation products.


The projects we work on in our team can, for example, be about building a new process industry (such as a dairy), but also building or streamlining a production process. It can also be about preliminary studies - to propose and assess how the projects should be carried out. In this role, there may likely be consulting assignments with our customers.


We have a well-defined quality system and project methodology, which enables us to offer our customers a complete application solution, including testing, commissioning, quality assurance and documentation. We work according to standards and guidelines such as; ISA S88, ISA S95 and GAMP.

  


**Qualifications**


To enjoy and succeed in the role, we believe that you:


* Has a few years of experience in process automation.
* Have experience working in projects and it is good if you have a good understanding of the other technical disciplines.
* Has knowledge and experience of SattLine and/or ABB 800xA
* It is good if you have experience from the food and/or pharmaceutical industry.
* Has very good knowledge of English. Swedish is a Plus
* Have a B driver's license, as shorter and longer journeys will be part of the work, sometimes.

  




You can reach out to us at Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com or careers@swediumglobal.com


  
Job Overview


* Location : Malmo, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Automation, Food Industy, ABB 800xA

title: Data Engineers och Data/Business Analysts
description:
Vi söker dig som brinner för data! Dig som har erfarenhet av att hantera data, både backend och frontend, och har gjort det i några år. Vi söker dig som har briljanta idéer om vad man skulle kunna göra men som inte fått gehör eller utlopp för din kreativitet. Vi vill att du som tycker att Analytics är fantastiskt men också att more is more (när det gäller data) ska komma och joina vår business line Data & Insights och vara med på vår gemensamma resa framåt!

  

Plats


Stockholm , På plats


Upplägg


Heltid


Ansök senast


Löpande rekrytering

**Vi söker Data Engineers och Data/Business Analysts till vår business line Data & Insights**



På Consid har vi sedan länge jobbat med kunder inom områden som Digital Transformation, Cloud-tjänster, App-utveckling, IoT och AI. Med vår business line Data & Insights satsar vi nu stort på att hjälpa våra kunder att ta ytterligare ett steg framåt genom att knyta ihop alla delar med data i fokus. Vi vill hjälpa dem att ta vara på och använda sin data på alla vis, från traditionell analytics till ännu ej påhittade sätt. Vi letar därför efter duktiga Data Engineers och Data/Business Analysts att ansluta till vårt nationella team med omkring 30 medarbetare runt om i landet.



Vi vill kunna erbjuda våra kunder den bästa lösningen för att tillgodose deras specifika behov och krav och därför vill vi inte låsa oss vid att arbeta med bara en plattform eller ett särskilt verktyg. Vi ser därför att du är en hejare på NÅGOT av allt det som vi vill kunna leverera. Vidare tror vi att du är en driven och lösningsorienterad teamspelare som gärna vill vara med och fortsätta bygga detta team.


**Är detta något för dig?**



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan genom att skicka in CV eller Linkedin-profil samt personligt brev. Intervjuer sker löpande så sök gärna redan idag!


**Din kompetens**
-----------------


Minst 5 års arbetserfarenhet inom något/några av områden, plattformar och verktyg som exempelvis Data Architecture, Business Anlysis, Data Engineering, Data Integration, Data Modelling, SQL, Snowflake, DBT, Matillion, Azure Data Factory, SSIS, MDM, GCP, Synapse eller Databricks.**Meriterande**
---------------


Relevant universitetsutbildning som tex. civilingenjör, systemvetare, ekonom eller motsvarande KY-utbildning inom Data Engineering.
God förmåga att uttrycka sig väl på svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift.**Fördelar hos Consid**
-----------------------


Centralt kontor


Din arbetsplats är en mötesplats med vackra lokaler som dessutom är centralt belägna med goda förbindelser.


Bred kompetens


Med över 40 kontor runt om i Europa finns mycket kunskap och kompetens inom många olika områden.


Jobba med det senaste


Få stora möjligheter att arbeta med nya och moderna tekniker och arbetssätt.


Bred kundbas


Med kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor och med över 150 ramavtal får du variation och trygghet.

**Vi erbjuder**
---------------


Consid är ett av Europas snabbast växande företag med över 1800 medarbetare på över 40 kontor. Trots vår storlek och snabba tillväxt lägger vi väldigt stort fokus på individen och den lokala kulturen. Ända sedan Consid grundades har ambitionen varit att skapa en arbetsplats som passar dig oavsett vilken fas i livet du befinner dig i. Vi är därför väldigt måna om att se varje individ och vara lyhörda för vad som är viktigt för just dig, din utveckling och din personliga situation. Som medarbetare hos oss delar du dina dagar med riktigt duktiga kollegor som mer än gärna byter erfarenheter, så väl lokalt som nationellt och internationellt. Vi gillar även att göra saker ihop och lär känna varandra genom en rad aktiviteter, så som exempelvis familjeaktiviteter, after works, träningsaktiviteter och spelkvällar. Och massor av annat kul, förstås! En typisk Considare älskar att överträffa kunders och kollegors förväntningar, men värderar också en sund balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv.

  



**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**
------------------------------


Marika Bråson i rekryteringsteamet svarar gärna på dina frågor.


Marika Bråson


Rekrytering Stockholm


marika.brason@consid.se

title: Commercial Advisor- SAP Expert
description:
**Company Description**  

H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe-essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M: Learn more about H&M | H&M Careers (hm.com)

 **Job Description**  

We are hiring a Commercial Advisor to provide expert commercial support to our Business Tech organization and hubs. The successful candidate will deliver significant business value throughout the product lifecycle by leveraging their experience in tech sourcing and procurement. This role involves the rigorous development of business cases, executing high-quality, market-competitive deals, and optimizing ongoing relationships with external partners.  

  

As a Commercial Advisor, you will utilize your leadership skills and commitment to a nonhierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust. Your focus will be on value creation, growth, and delivering exceptional customer and business results.  



***Key Responsibilities:***

* Support leaders in defining and implementing commercial and partner strategies.
* Negotiate advantageous terms with external partners.
* Screen potential new partners and collaborations, with a focus on tech partnerships
* Establish and implement strategic parameters for partner portfolios, ensuring optimal long-term management.
* Manage collaboration and performance according to frameworks, assessing risks versus expected business outcomes.
* Oversee risk management for partner and vendor contracts and agreements.
* Challenge existing commercial models and propose new strategies for optimizing tech partnerships.
* Devise negotiation strategies and processes tailored to each deal.
* Identify potential deal designs to meet objectives, such as risk aversion versus creating optionality.
* Manage dealmaking processes, including RFPs, tendering, and time planning.
* Ensure compliance with H&M Group Purchasing and Consultant Policy.
* Execute deals in alignment with initial objectives.
* Continuously acquire knowledge of relevant technologies and business needs through supplier and market analyses.
* Monitor and act on spend analyses.
* Support the setup of collaboration and governance between product stakeholders, partners, and vendors.
* Manage contract life cycles, including extensions, renegotiations, terminations, and call offs.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Proven experience of 5+ years in managing people, vendors, and technology in the global environment.
* Strong expertise in SAP a key requisite.
* Proficient negotiator with expertise in managing relationships with technology manufacturers and service providers.
* Excellent organizational and structuring skills for complex matters.
* Preference for experience with cloud companies.
* Solid foundation in procurement and supplier management best practices.
* Ability to develop, establish, and train processes.
* Bottom-line thinker with a deep understanding of tech-related business cases.
* Proficient in tech fundamentals such as software development, architecture, integration, cloud, web applications, and microservices.
* Strong analytical skills, including KPI (Key Performance Indicators) development and business case construction.
* Methodical thinker capable of connecting business case objectives to necessary actions.
* Effective critical thinking skills and a pragmatic approach.
* Ability to influence and persuade others.
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to provide constructive challenges.

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a **permanent** based in **Stockholm** with a start date as soon as possible. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than **15th September 2024**. Interviews will be held continuously.

  

**Benefits**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.  

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

At H&M Group, we are determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: AI & Machine learning in our apps
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
Role Overview
The consultant will be responsible for investigating and evaluating different methods of integrating generative language models into our software products. This includes exploring both on-device deployment on Windows and iOS platforms, as well as cloud-based solutions.


Responsibilities* Investigate On-Device Deployment:
* Identify candidate generative language models suitable for on-device deployment on Windows and iOS.
* Evaluate the performance and compatibility of these models with the target hardware.
* Optimize and Test Models:
* Identify and evaluate techniques for optimizing on-device performance, such as quantization, pruning, knowledge distillation.
* Conduct thorough performance testing on target platforms, including iPadOS and Windows.
* Benchmark key metrics such as resource consumption, speed, and power usage by creating reproducible performance testing setups and methodologies.
* Fine-tune selected models to support specific use cases.
* Evaluate Cloud-Based Models:
* Assess the feasibility and performance of cloud-based generative language models for integration with our software.
* Benchmark quality and performance by identifying and measuring key metrics, including inference latency, throughput, and scalability.
* Financial and Compliance Analysis:
* Analyze the financial impact of using different cloud-based models, considering subscription fees, data storage costs, and usage fees.
* Investigate privacy and compliance concerns, ensuring adherence to GDPR and other relevant regulations.
* Develop Recommendations:
* Provide detailed recommendations for both on-device and cloud-based model integration.
* Outline potential next steps, including further optimization, extensive testing, or production integration.
* Suggest long-term strategies for maintaining and improving deployed models.


Skills and Qualifications* Demonstrated experience in machine learning and generative AI.
* Expertise in deploying and testing AI models on both Windows and iOS platforms.
* Strong background in performance evaluation and optimization of AI models.
* Familiarity with cloud-based AI solutions and their integration.
* Understanding of privacy and security issues, especially GDPR compliance.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills for documenting processes and providing clear recommendations.

 **General info**

* Expected duration: 4-6 months.
* Full time
* Semi remote (around 3 days/week in the office) so needs to be close to Stockholm

  
Alex Kouchmeshki
Country Manager


alex@emagine-consulting.se
+46 722005458

title: Content and Communication Manager
description:
We are looking for a Content & Communication Manager for our amazing team at Avinode Group. The Content & Communications Manager enhances our brand’s visibility, reputation, and engagement within business aviation through strategic content creation and communication activities. This role leverages automation and AI technologies to optimize and scale our efforts, driving initiatives that create value for our customers, maximize engagement, and increase brand reputation across all content and channels.


### **What you will do**


**Content Strategy & Production**


* Develop and execute a comprehensive content strategy aligned with our messaging framework and brand voice.
* Create engaging content for various channels (website, newsletters, press releases, whitepapers, social media)
* Manage the editorial calendar and content production process, utilizing AI-powered tools to streamline workflows.
* Identify thought leadership opportunities and industry trends using AI-driven analytics.
* Implement SEO best practices and AI-assisted content optimization techniques.
* Define and track KPIs for editorial activities, focusing on engagement metrics.


**Communication & PR**


* Execute communication strategies across all organizational touchpoints
* Plan and coordinate speaking engagements at events and conferences
* Manage PR agency relationships and media inquiries
* Prepare press releases and media pitches for brand initiatives
* Develop crisis communication plans and protocols
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align messaging
* Implement social listening tools to gather real-time insights


**Brand Management**


* Ensure consistent application of brand voice and visual identity across the company
* Contribute to brand asset development and management
* Provide insights on messaging effectiveness for different audience segments
* Utilize data-driven recommendations to refine brand messaging for various audiences


**Performance Metrics**


* Monitor and analyze communication effectiveness using data analytics tools.
* Provide regular reports on communication metrics and business impact
* Track ROI across all communication efforts

### **What we are looking for**


* Bachelor’s degree in communication or equivalent
* 4+ years of experience in B2B communication, preferably in aviation
* Proven track record in content creation, social media strategy, and PR
* Strong copywriting and project management skills
* Proficiency in SEO, marketing automation tools, and CRM systems
* Familiarity with AI-powered marketing tools and automation platforms
* Analytical skills and data-driven decision-making ability
* Adaptability to new technologies and industry trends
* English fluency
* Experience in video content creation (preferred)
* Able to role model core Avinode Group values.


This role requires a dynamic professional to drive engagement through innovative content strategies and leverage cutting-edge technologies to optimize communication efforts across all job aspects.


### **What do we offer you?**


We are proud to offer you a workplace where we have high engagement and where creativity and curiosity are always much appreciated. Your ideas will be heard.


* Ability to schedule your calendar with flexible work locations.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Synergy events are where all Noders meet each other to collaborate on a professional level and have fun, which is equally important.
* There are great opportunities to develop special skills or to learn new things with training. We want to support your development and dreams.

### **Want to join our crew?**


Find more fun facts about our Noders (that’s what we call ourselves) and our culture on our website.


### **About Avinode Group**


Avinode Group, owned by CAMP Systems, offers a fully connected suite of essential B2B software to enable Business Aviation professionals through the entire workflow of managing, sourcing, and booking aircraft. Founded in the heart of Sweden in 2002, we support around 2,000 companies globally.


Our essential tools are designed to minimize stress and maximize profit for brokers and operators. The suite includes the world’s leading sourcing platform for air charter, making it easy to find aircraft, book trips, and market aircraft globally. Air charter operators and flight departments are provided with a fully cloud-based fleet management system to make flight operations smoother. Our customers can rely on a hassle-free process from quoting to booking and paying with a fully integrated payment solution.


With 150+ Noders spread between Sweden and the US, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers everyone to come forward with new ideas, try them out, make some mistakes, and initiate dialogue. Avinode Group seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work alongside other intelligent, humorous, and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us daily to exceed expectations.


Avinode Group is an equal opportunity employer and cares about having the best people for the job. We care about your skills and who you are as a person.


Want more details? Discover the value our essentials bring to our customers every day.

title: ServiceNow Business Analyst
description:
**The Cloud People, is a Full ServiceNow Lifecycle Partner that is growing rapidly in Europe, US and Brazil. For our offices in Norway (Oslo) and Sweden (Stockholm) we are looking for a Business Analyst**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





##### **Job description**


As a Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and the ServiceNow engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering and analyzing business requirements, designing solutions, and ensuring that the final product aligns with business objectives. This involves enhancing processes, coordinating with stakeholders, and meticulously documenting requirements. A key responsibility is to understand the client's business challenges and effectively communicate these needs to the ServiceNow engineering team.  

  

**Responsibilities** **include****:**

**Requirements Gathering and Analysis:**

* Collect, document, and analyze business requirements from various stakeholders.
* Map and understand current business processes and identify areas for improvement.
* Define clear and measurable requirements that the development team can use as a foundation for development.

**Process Improvement:**

* Analyze existing business processes and suggest improvements to increase efficiency and productivity.
* Create process flowcharts and other documents that illustrate how new systems or processes will function.

**Solution Design and Validation:**

* Collaborate with the development team to develop solutions that meet business requirements.
* Perform testing and validate that the solution works as expected and meets business objectives.
* Manage changes in the project and update requirement documentation as necessary.
* Conducts system testing and facilitates user acceptance testing

**Communication and Coordination:**

* Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the development team.
* Ensure that all parties have a common understanding of the requirements and solutions.
* Facilitate workshops and meetings with stakeholders to gather requirements and present solutions.

**Reporting and Documentation:**

* Prepare reports, test plans and documentation describing processes, requirements, solutions, and changes.
* Monitor project progress and ensure that solutions are implemented as planned.

##### **Personal Attributes:**

* **Detail-Oriented:** Ability to work accurately with complex data and documentation.
* **Proactive:** Ability to identify issues and opportunities at an early stage.
* **Team-Oriented:** Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.

**Qualifications**

* 3+ years of business analysis experience or a related field
* Degree or equivalent in Business, Information Systems, or Computer Science
* Prior working knowledge of ServiceNow
* Experience with Agile
* Fluent English and Norwegian or Swedish
* Ability to understand business processes and their definitions
* Solid problem solving and analytical skills
* Ability to work effectively with people at all levels of the organization
* Client-focused approach with outstanding interpersonal skills

  


Department
Delivery
Locations
The Cloud People, Stockholm (Sweden), The Cloud People, Oslo (Norway)
Remote status
Hybrid Remote
Contact Marianne Hisdal Group HR & Capability Manager

title: Domain Architect - Digital Workplace
description:
**Job Description**  

Don’t miss this chance to join H&M Group’s Digital Workplace Unit, responsible for the digital workplace experience and site tech foundation at H&M Group globally. The unit consists of eleven engineering teams across three areas – Digital Workplace Platforms, Digital Workplace Devices, and Site Tech Engineering. Together, the teams design, develop, and operate all workplace infrastructure used by H&M Group across our offices, stores, and warehouses worldwide. This includes enterprise-wide platforms and applications used for collaboration, communication & design (e.g. MS365, Adobe Creative Cloud, Atlassian, and Voice & Video), End User Computing (e.g. Devices, VDI, MDM), and core infrastructure on site (e.g. network, edge compute, RFID, IoT).


As a Domain Architect within our Digital Workplace organization, you will have a pivotal role in the Business Tech function at H&M Group. You will be responsible for driving the future architecture and design of our Digital Workplace platforms, proactively developing, and maintaining the architectural vision and strategic roadmaps. Reporting to the Global Head of Digital Workplace and being a key member of the Digital Workplace Leadership Team, your work will directly impact how our teams connect, collaborate, and innovate across the globe. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Head of Digital Workplace, Area Lead Engineers, and Solution Architects, acting as a role model for our engineering teams and supporting them with technical know-how and architectural guidance. Your excellent stakeholder management skills will enable you to proactively engage with business stakeholders, Security, Legal, Commercial, Enterprise Architecture teams, and our external service providers. With your strategic mindset and deep technical knowledge, you will be instrumental in providing H&M’s colleagues with relevant, scalable, and secure digital workplace solutions. You will also be at the forefront of innovation, evaluating and recommending new software, hardware, and vendors while optimizing the use of existing technologies.


Moreover, at H&M Group, we are making significant investments to transform our physical stores globally, ensuring our stores not only meet today’s needs but also anticipate and adapt to future trends, providing an unparallelled shopping experience. Elevating our tech foundation in store is of highest priority and, as Domain Architect, you will play a key role in establishing our global store tech foundation blueprint, standards, guardrails, and governance processes that are scalable, secure, and designed to meet the future needs of our customers and business.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Strategic Planning: Develop and implement a comprehensive digital workplace architecture strategy and roadmap that aligns with the organization's business objectives.
* Architecture Design: Design the architecture for systems and solutions within the digital workplace domain, ensuring they are scalable, secure, and efficient. Create and maintain architectural blueprints, guidelines, and standards.
* Solution Delivery: Guide the implementation of architecture solutions, ensuring they meet design specifications and business requirements. Provide technical oversight and support during the development and deployment phases.
* Innovation: Identify emerging technologies and trends to drive continuous improvement and innovation within the digital workplace domain.
* Stakeholder Mgmt.: Collaborate with senior leadership and in cross-functional teams across Tech, HR, and business units, to understand their needs and deliver tailored digital solutions.
* Governance: Establish and enforce best practices, standards, and governance frameworks to ensure the security, reliability, and scalability of digital workplace solutions.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience (±10 years) as a Domain Architect or similar role with a focus on Digital Workplace solutions.
* Deep knowledge of Digital Workplace technologies including communication & collaboration tools incl. Ms365, Voice & Video, and end-user computing.
* Strong expertise in site tech infrastructure, engineering, network technologies, and cloud services.
* Extensive experience in IT ecosystems and system integration.
* Demonstrated success in developing and implementing comprehensive digital workplace strategies that align with business objectives.
* Excellent leadership and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to inspire teams towards a common vision.
* Experience in vendor/supplier management.
* Familiarity with regulatory compliance, data privacy, and cybersecurity best practices.
* Experience with Google Workplace, Slack, GCP is a plus.
* An innovative mindset with a passion for driving continuous improvement and staying at the forefront of emerging technologies.

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a **full-time permanent position**, starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.  

Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page. **Please submit your Resume** to provide a valuable insight into your professional background and specific reasons why you are enthusiastic about the opportunity.


If you have any questions about the role, please add them along your application and responsible recruiter will address them.

**Benefits**


We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**Inclusion & Diversity**

*At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*

**Company Description**


H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Senior Distinguished Architect for ADAS & Infotainment
description:
We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.
  
Join us to lead innovative design and development for ADAS, Infotainment, SDV, and cloud computing, driving the future of automotive technology!
  
We are seeking a highly experienced and visionary Senior Distinguished Architect to lead the architectural design and development of our ADAS, Infotainment, SDV, and cloud computing initiatives. In this role, you will have a significant impact on the future of automotive technology, guiding our teams in creating groundbreaking solutions that are both scalable and future-proof.
  
The Opportunity
  
**Architectural Leadership:** Define and lead the architectural vision for ADAS, Infotainment, SDV, and cloud computing systems, ensuring alignment with industry standards, customer needs, and company goals.
  
**SDV and Cloud Computing Strategy:** Develop and implement strategies for integrating SDV and cloud computing into our automotive solutions, driving innovation and scalability.
  
**Technical Expertise:** Oversee the design and integration of cloud-based services with in-vehicle systems, ensuring seamless connectivity, data management, and real-time processing capabilities.
  
**Cross-functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with engineering, product management, and design teams to ensure the cohesive integration of SDV, ADAS, and Infotainment systems into our vehicles.
  
**Innovation and Research:** Lead the exploration of emerging technologies in SDV, cloud computing, and automotive software, positioning Zeekrtech EU at the cutting edge of the industry.
  
**Mentorship:** Provide guidance and mentorship to engineering teams, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
  
**Stakeholder Communication:** Engage with internal and external stakeholders, including senior leadership and partners, to communicate architectural decisions, project progress, and strategic roadmaps.
  
**Quality Assurance:** Ensure all designs meet the highest standards of quality, safety, and performance, particularly in the integration of cloud and vehicle systems.
  
  

You and Your Skills
  
15+ years of experience in automotive architecture, with a focus on ADAS, Infotainment, SDV, and cloud computing systems.
  
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
  
Extensive knowledge of SDV, cloud computing, automotive systems, software development, embedded systems, and hardware integration.
  
Proven ability to lead complex, large-scale projects and cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
  
Demonstrated track record of innovation in automotive technology, with a passion for advancing SDV and cloud-based solutions.
  
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts for diverse audiences.
  
In-depth understanding of automotive industry standards, regulations, and best practices, particularly in the European market.
  
  

Why should you join us?
  
Let's face it, there are plenty of opportunities out there. But here's why joining us is a game-changer:
  
**Culture & Community:** We're more than just colleagues—we're a tight-knit community that supports and celebrates each other's successes.
  
**Opportunity for Growth:** At Zeekr Tech Eu, your growth is our priority. We provide ample opportunities for learning, development, and advancement.
  
**Impactful Work:** Make a real difference! Join us in tackling exciting challenges and contributing to projects that have a positive impact on our customers and society.
  
**Flexibility & Balance:** We understand that life happens, which is why we offer flexibility and work-life balance to ensure you can thrive both personally and professionally.
  
**Perks & Benefits:** From competitive salaries to awesome perks like 30 vacation days, 8 additional ATK days and an annual STI program to reward your performance, we've got you covered.
  
  

Do you want to join us on our journey? Welcome, to contact us for more information:
  
  

Christian Hering, Head of Customer Experience, christian.hering@zeekrtech.eu, for questions regarding the position.
  
Kristina Larsson Djokovic, Senior Recruiter, kristina.larsson@zeekrtech.eu, +46 72 988 85 44, for questions regarding the recruitment process.
  
**Last Application date:** 2024-08-29
  
Apply today, we will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you.
  
To find out more about Zeekr Tech EU, visit our website. Read more about our recruitment process here.
  
Please note that due to GDPR, we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

title: Senior Verification Strategist & Coordinator
description:
We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.
  
Become our Senior Verification Strategist & Coordinator to lead the E2E software verification strategy for Zeekr's car software in Europe!
  
We seek a highly experienced Senior Verification Strategist and Coordinator to define and lead the end-to-end (E2E) software verification strategy for Zeekr’s car software in Europe. This role will encompass ADAS, infotainment, and cloud systems, ensuring alignment with the SDV era and close cooperation with our Chinese headquarters.
  
What You'll Do
  
**E2E Verification Strategy Development:** Define and implement a comprehensive E2E software verification strategy for all Zeekr car software in Europe, focusing on ADAS, infotainment, and cloud integration.
  
**SDV Alignment:** Ensure that all verification processes and strategies are aligned with the requirements and expectations of the Software-Defined Vehicle (SDV) era, staying ahead of industry trends.
  
**Cross-Functional Coordination:** Coordinate efforts between European teams and our Chinese headquarters, fostering strong communication and collaboration to ensure consistency and quality across all software platforms.

**Stakeholder Engagement:** Act as the primary point of contact for all software verification-related activities in Europe, engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment and successful project delivery.
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

10+ years of experience in software verification, particularly within the automotive industry, with a strong focus on ADAS, infotainment, and cloud technologies.
  
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  
Deep understanding of software verification methodologies, tools, and industry standards, particularly as they apply to SDVs.
  
Proven ability to develop and implement strategic plans for complex, large-scale software verification projects.
  
Experience working in a global environment, with a proven track record of successfully collaborating with teams across different regions.
  
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Chinese is a plus.

**Perks & Benefits:** From competitive salaries to awesome perks like 30 vacation days, 8 additional ATK days and an annual STI program to reward your performance, we've got you covered.
  
  

Do you want to join us on our journey? Welcome, to contact us for more information:
  
  

Christian Hering, Head of Customer Experience, christian.hering@zeekrtech.eu, for questions regarding the position.

title: Network Architect
description:
Network Architect – NOVO Energy, Gothenburg
  
We are looking for a Network Architect to join our growing team and help us implement and develop cloud-first, state-of-the-art factory solutions. If you're a hands-on Network Architect eager to build the network infrastructure for our Industry 4.0 solutions, we'd love to discuss this role with you.
  
  

Our mission
  
Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Torslanda will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with the potential to produce battery cells for half a million Volvo cars per year.
  
  

The role
  
As a Network Architect, you will get the opportunity to implement and operate some of the worlds most advanced IoT networks that is the foundation for NOVO Energy’s Gigafactory in close collaboration with Northvolt. This is a unique opportunity to work with networking solutions that integrate across multiple domains and will evolve towards full automation ("network as a code") of the network infrastructure.
  
  

Your main responsibilities will be to design, build and operate a network based on principles from Northvolt. You will also be expected to use your in-depth knowledge of the network to participate in the resolution of complex network problems in the factory networks, datacenters, public cloud(s) and office networks.
  
This role requires frequent travels to Stockholm to work with, and learn from the Northvolt teams.
  
  

Key responsibilities
  
  

* Implementing strategic network and security designs following industry best practices.
* Determine the appropriate hardware, software and other equipment based on the organizations' resources and needs.
* Ensuring efficient support and maintenance of the current network, with a pro-active approach to constantly increase stability.
* Be able to examine network designs to identify issues.
* Help us build a great team and make NOVO Energy a great place to work!


Your skills and experiences
  
You will be expected to use your in-depth knowledge of the network to participate in the resolution of complex network problems in the factory networks, datacenters, public cloud(s) and office networks.
  
Deep working knowledge of the Cisco suite of products is highly beneficial.
  
  

As a person we see that you have an ability to communicate and collaborate well with team members. You are comfortable managing stakeholders (across all areas of the business) to gather requirements and present solutions. You’re are great listener and a skilled negotiator that take a consultative approach to identifying the best solutions for the business.
  
  

You have a structured way of working and take pride in ensuring your documentation is easy to understand and detailed enough to support the implementation of your design ideas. Sharing knowledge and building up others is something you love to spend your time on, and continuous improvement drives everything you do.
  
  

**To deliver in this complex task, we see that you bring:**  

* Minimum 8 years of experience in network design, development and operations.
* Experience in large scale network monitoring, automation, and testing.
* Basic knowledge of AWS/Azure Cloud networks.
* Familiar with Industrial Ethernet or any deterministic Ethernet protocols.
* Experience in GIT, terraform and Python.
* In-depth knowledge of network hardware and software technologies and best practice.
* Advanced knowledge of a network technology discipline (e.g. IP Routing and Switching, Routing Protocols, WAN, Firewall, Packet Analysis, Infrastructure, Capacity Planning, IT Tools and other relevant technologies).
* Hands on experience with network services such as DHCP, DNS, radius.
* Experience with wireless network design and implementation.
* Good knowledge of Cisco ISE for authentication and authorization for clients.
* Experience in Cisco Intent Based Networking.
* Hands-on experience with with Cisco IOS, IOS-XE and NXOS.
* Adequate knowledge about Software defined networking SDN, preferably Cisco ACI.
* Experience with Cisco Hyperconverged solution.
* Hands-on experience with Cisco ASA and Firepower.
* Hands-on experience with Palo Alto firewalls.


What’s in it for you?
  
This is a truly rare opportunity for an experienced architect to design, implement and operationalize a cloud first network - from scratch. Using best-of-breed technology, this network will need to meet the needs of highly automated manufacturing and thousands of employees with a focus on safety, security, and speed.
  
  

Our small and steadily growing IT team is a highly collaborative team working together to solve interesting problems. Together we innovate, reinvent, and learn quickly to build a world class Gigafactory, establishing a new high-tech industry in Gothenburg and build an exceptional business. Currently in a scale-up phase, this is an outstanding opportunity for you to make an outsized impact, contribute to our shared success and to grow your role, remit and career together with us.
  
  

Our expansion is rapid, and in coming years there will be 3,000 of us operating in a high-tech manufacturing setting where IT will be a critical enabler.
  
  

Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Gothenburg will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh) - thereby enabling a supply of batteries for approximately half a million Volvo cars per year. Our state-of-the-art R&D facility will gather leading expertise from all over the world, to create the next generation battery cells.
  
  

You can read more about this joint venture in these press releases, here and here.

title: Manufacturing Systems Integration Engineer – MES
description:
One foot on the floor, the other in the cloud(s)?
  
  

Are you a Software Engineer comfortable in straddling the space between equipment and cloud?
  
We’re now looking for a Manufacturing Systems Integration Engineer to develop and implement a cutting-edge MES solution that will be the backbone of battery cell production at our Gigafactory in Torslanda.
  
  

NOVO Energy
  
  

NOVO Energy is a Northvolt Volvo Cars joint venture formed to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo and Polestar cars. We are building a state-of-the-art facility for research and development of the next generation of battery cells. By joining NOVO Energy, you get a unique opportunity to prepare for the electrification of automotive whilst contributing to a climate-neutral way of life for future generations.
  
  

The opportunity (and challenge)
  
  

Battery manufacturing is a tech-lovers dream. An environment filled with specialized equipment, high-level engineering solutions, cutting-edge technology and incredibly people working together. Connecting it all is our Manufacturing Execution System (MES). Based on a Northvolt concept, this cloud-first solution will be the key to monitor and optimize our battery production from start-to-end.
  
And we need you to help us build it.
  
  

Manufacturing Systems Integration Engineer
  
  

Working alongside a committed team and in close collaboration with our partners at Northvolt, you will influence this critical project at every level throughout its entire lifecycle. From design and implementation all the way to ongoing improvements in the production environment.
  
Responsible for system setup, equipment integration design, configuration, deployment, testing and validation, this is a rare opportunity for a driven software engineer looking to test their skills and build smart-factory solutions for the future.
  
  

* System and integration design.
* Deploy and configure MES functionality according to detailed technical design.
* Review, test and validate supplier connectivity implementation and digitalization product functionality.
* Integrate MES functionality with the equipment.
* Prepare and support in supplier workshops.
* Support & lead technical solution design for equipment integration projects.
* Collaborate with the MES development engineers, platform engineers and equipment suppliers.
* Factory support connected to MES system.
* Frequent travel to Stockholm to work with our partners in the Northvolt team.


What you’ll bring to the table
  
  

We believe you are a strong team player who enjoys working with cross-functional teams and external parties to invent and problem solve. You’re purpose driven and understand that the mission is to establish a Gigafactory where the time plan is tight, and collaboration is key. You bring well-developed technical skills, problem solving abilities and you’re comfortable in finding ways to move forward under ambiguous circumstances.
  
You're reliable reliable and structured and prde yourself in delivering high-quality work and looking after those around you.
  
  

Your background includes;
  
  

* BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mechatronics - or equivalent experience gained from work.
* Experience as a software engineer, preferably in a forward-deployed or integration-focused role involving manufacturing equipment or embedded software.
* Knowledge of algorithms, data structures, concurrency, distributed systems, and eventual consistency.
* Proficiency in Golang, Python, Java, C++ and experience with software development frameworks.
* Experience working with cloud solutions e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP etc.
* Bonus points for specific skills in Git, Kubernetes, Micro services, and AWS cloud tools.


Why join us?
  
  

As an Engineer, we can promise you highly interesting work pushing the boundaries of manufacturing technologies.
  
As a human we promise an excellent team environment with mature minded and kind people.
  
Our rapidly growing IT & Software is a highly collaborative group working together to solve interesting problems. Together we innovate, reinvent, and learn quickly to develop the technology required to run a world class Gigafactory.
  
Currently in a scale-up phase, this is an outstanding opportunity for you to make an outsized impact, contribute to our shared success and to grow your role, remit and career together with us.
  
  

Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo and Polestar cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Gothenburg will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh) - thereby enabling a supply of batteries for approximately half a million Volvo and Polestar cars per year. Our state-of-the-art R&D facility will gather leading expertise from all over the world, to create the next generation battery cells.
  
  

You can read more about this joint venture in these press releases, here and here.

title: Senior Customer Solutions Manager – Automotive Industry
description:
* Previous experience leading complex, large-scale IT/digital/business transformation programs
* Previous experience in a senior customer facing role
* Superior written and verbal communication skills, including a demonstrated ability to effectively deliver information to c-suite/VP level
* Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with precise attention to detail


AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

Our Customer Solutions Managers guide our customers on their journey to the AWS cloud, as single-threaded leaders skilled at leveraging the vast resources available from within our company and across our partners.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
Working as the single-threaded delivery leader and strategic business partner helping your customer achieve their business outcomes and drive innovation.
  
  

As an AWS CSM you will enable stakeholder alignment, build team cohesion, and manage project risks while working with the Global Account Manager, Partner Manager, Enterprise Service Manager, and our Services Team.
  
  

You will engage the customer and AWS executives to define program strategy, remove blockers, and resolve funding issues. You will translate strategic initiatives in the account plan into executable actions, working backwards from our customer’s key milestones. You will drive the execution of enablement plans, acceleration programs, Executive Briefing Sessions, and go-live events.
  
  

Successful candidates will have a strong delivery and change management background, be detail oriented, have excellent problem-solving abilities, and be exemplary communicators both at the executive and project team level. You will be a peer leader, have the ability to gain stakeholder buy-in, negotiate, and lead virtual teams.
  
  

You will evangelize AWS services and influence customer adoption. You should be passionate about delivering a great customer experience by deploying AWS solutions and inspiring innovation. You will be obsessed with contributing to the day-to-day management of your customers successful adoption of AWS.
  
  

Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact? Come build the future with us.
  
  

A day in the life
  
We are seeking a Customer Solutions Manager (CSM) to join our Automotive & Manufacturing organization, where you will work with one of the largest and most complex Automotive OEMs in the world, enabling their multi-year journey to the cloud. In this highly visible position, the CSM is a thought leader that acts as a trusted customer advisor ensuring all AWS teams are working together effectively to deliver transformational outcomes for the customer.
  
  

About the team
  
AWS Automotive & Manufacturing is responsible for defining and executing our Go-To-Market and Customer Success strategies for the automotive and manufacturing industries worldwide.
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

* Robust understanding of Automotive manufacturing and production IT, including direct experience with global automotive OEMs and Tier 1 suppliers
* Direct experience implementing AWS/cloud services
* Demonstrable understanding of key technology and market trends
* Experience with a revenue realization in throughout complex IT transformations
* Deep understanding of software development/engineering life-cycle from conception to delivery


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Be part of a team that is successfully implementing the most advanced and intelligent technologies for our customers. We are currently looking for an experienced
 **Service Delivery Manager** 
 to join our team in Sweden (Our Office is located in
 **Stockholm** 
 ).
 



  





 As our new
 **Service Delivery Manager** 
 , you will be at the forefront of implementing the most advanced technologies for our customers. Your mission is to ensure exceptional service delivery, meet financial targets, and create a sustainable work environment for your team.
 



  





 Within this role, your responsibilities and tasks will include:
 


* Establish the right environment and assembling the right team to deliver on client commitments and expectations.
* Ensure transparency and performance visibility to the client and to Roboyo leadership.
* Ensure engagement data is continuously and accurately being gathered and published to the relevant stakeholders.
* Monitor ticket dashboard and prioritizing tasks for service delivery team members to ensure SLAs are satisfied.
* Publish periodic reports to client stakeholders, other members of the engagement team, and Roboyo leadership and governance groups to provide full transparency into performance of the service objects under care and performance of the Roboyo managed services team.
* Ensure the lead engineer is consistently enforcing adherence to standards and best practices and has a complete quality assurance process in place.
* Ensure the service delivery team has access to required systems, tools, environments, and client experts to efficiently perform their work.
* Ensure the necessary environments, tools, pipelines, and test data are in place to properly test and deploy service objects into production.
* Ensure the service delivery team is frequently and consistently updating tickets with the latest information as they progress through diagnosis and resolution.
* Monitor the performance of service objects and the performance of the service delivery team to ensure service level commitments are satisfied.
* Ensure that clients receive services commensurate with their resource allocation every month, leveraging extra time on months where incidents or client-driven requests are low to provide proactive services where possible.
* Ensure all engagement members submit all timesheets every week, with at least 40 hours, and reflecting what engagements and items were worked on as accurately as they are able.
* Log into client systems for every engagement they are assigned to at least once every thirty days and quickly checking in on the service objects to ensure they stay up to date and keep their client accounts active.
* Handle exceptional conditions and collaborating with client stakeholders to resolve them successfully.
* Schedule review sessions business stakeholders and the Business Analyst to gather feedback and identify improvement opportunities.
* ​Coordinate with IT stakeholders and the Business Analyst to manage system changes and service updates.



  





  





**Requirements** 



* Relevant experience in technical service delivery and programming IT solutions, preferably with .NET, C#, VBA, Java, PowerShell or Python
* Relevant experience with automation technologies (Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath, etc.).
* Excellent communication skills and social competence for establishing and maintaining strong relationships with leadership, peers, direct reports and customers
* Team player attitude with willingness to learn new skills related to new automation and digitization topics, such as AI, low code, IDP
* Understanding of customer processes and willingness to bring forward improvement ideas
* Able to deal with challenging customer and staffing issues in a professional and supportive manner and to see these through to resolution
* Fluent in English and Swedish. Additional languages a plus


- 


  





  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary package
* 30 days paid vacation
* Recognition and reward for individual and team achievements
* Regular team events
* You’ll love coming to our cozy office to meet your colleagues
* Significant opportunities for skills development and career progression including individual development plan with career coaching
* Global mobility

title: IT Technical Support Agent (Fixed term)
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We’re looking to hire an IT Technical Support Agent for a fixed term contract who will be based in Stockholm until the 31st of October 2025. There is the potential that the position is made permanent. In this role, you’ll support employees in Sweden and other Nordic countries with a wide area of IT-related matters, and be part of a Nordic Virtual Team. You will be required to travel on occasion.
 



  





 Since you are part of the international team, we hope you are able travel if needed to. You’ll work during office hours, but occasionally we might need your support in ad-hoc situations out of normal business hours. We wish to welcome an enthusiastic and dedicated colleague to join our team!
 



  





**About the team** 




 We have many hardworking and dedicated peers that would love for you to work with them. We are committed to continuous improvement. We are always looking for new and innovative ways to improve our market proposition, build excellent solutions, and grow customer happiness.
 



  





 You’ll report to IT Manager who is based in Stockholm, Sweden. The virtual team consists 3 peers in Sweden, 1 in Denmark and 1 in Finland. We are globally minded with a FinTech atmosphere. You will experience this in your everyday life as a Worldliner.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 



* Ongoing support for any local systems, services and administrative activities currently in the scope of the Local IT team which are not replaced by services delivered centrally
* CMDB maintenance
* Installations and settings-laptops
* Maintain all devices connected to WL network (printers, access badge printer, Wi-Fi routers, tv-screens, etc.)



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You consider yourself being organized and able to prioritize multiple ongoing tasks and are used to tackle challenges proactively. Natural interest towards IT and problem solving mindset are advantage in this position.
 



  





 Skills we can't do without:
 


* OS management in a mixed environment (Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android)
* Desktop imaging and deployment practices
* Experience with purchasing, inventory, and asset management
* Microsoft Azure admin
* Setup and support printer system (MFPs) in a corporate environment.
* Open to change and must be able to adapt to new systems quickly.



  





 Skills we'd like:
 


* Experience with Servicenow
* Drivers license and car
* Network fundamentals (patching, network configs, VPN, Firewalls, wireless, etc.)
* Experience with ticket-based enterprise workflow management systems, particularly JIRA, Confluence, as well as other Atlassian products.
* Self-motivated, with out of the box thinking and a logical mind.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 



  




* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution.** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at
 
 jobs.worldline.com**




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Junior Associate - McKinsey Digital
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will be based in our Stockholm office as part of our McKinsey Digital practice.
   

  

 McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to agile, cloud and digital business building.
   

  

 You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.
   

  

 When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You’ll work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement.
   

  

 This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.
   

  

 You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as more formal training in your first few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
* Outstanding records of academic and managerial or professional achievement
* Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting
* Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
* Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing
* Fluency in English; fluency in the local language is a plus
* Willingness to travel
