Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: System Integrator & Verification Engineer for Ultrasonics
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

Assignment Description
  
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a System Integrator & Verification Engineer for Ultrasonics.
  
  

**Main Responsibilities:**  

**Integration of Ultrasonic Components:** Integrate ultrasonic sensors into the host AUTOSAR ECU, ensuring seamless functionality. This includes managing and optimizing for network and CPU load, and addressing latency and timing issues effectively.
  
**Verification:** Conduct comprehensive verification of the ultrasonic sensors at various levels, including component, system, and in-vehicle testing.
  
**Test Automation Management:** Develop and manage automated test systems to streamline the verification process and ensure consistent quality.
  
**System Development Insight:** Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire system development process, recognizing and addressing interdependencies to ensure optimal performance.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Degree is not relevant if you can demonstrate a driven personality and technical competency.
  
Hold a European B driving license.
  
  

**Desired Attributes:**  

**Lifelong Learner:** Demonstrate that you are a lifelong learner, proactively seeking information to improve work efficiency. Team members are expected to constantly help each other, step out of specific role-related tasks, and prioritize what leads to the team’s success, including coaching, supporting, and sharing development information and tasks.
  
**Engaged and Driven:** Have a proactive and driving personality, capable of taking charge and closing topics effectively.
  
**Interdisciplinary Interest:** Enjoy working in a dynamic and interdisciplinary technology field, contributing to a collaborative and innovative environment.
  
  

**Additional Qualifications:**  

Experience with AUTOSAR ECUs.
  
Experience in generating ARXMLs for BSW & RTE configurations and integration from the AUTOSAR tool chain.
  
Knowledge of software development and integration processes, including Continuous Integration tools and methods (Jenkins, CI/CD, Gerrit).
  
Knowledge of classic and adaptive AUTOSAR.
  
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. (Mandatory)
  
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
  
Experience in ultrasonic sensor technology is a plus.
  
  

Note that not all additional qualifications are mandated as prerequisites. It is essential that there is a willingness to learn the aforementioned experiences and skills.

title: Test Engineer - Physical Crash Verification
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 3+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

For our client we are looking for a Test execution expert - Physical Crash verification
  
  

Description
  
At Clients Safety Centre, close to 200 highly skilled professionals strive every day for making the world a safer place for car drivers and everyone else on the road. They are proud of their track record to date including numerous world's firsts, all based on real world research and knowledge. The future challenges and opportunities are exciting and through advanced technology and research they are developing safety with regard to injury prevention and collision avoidance, in addition to areas like Autonomous Drive, HMI, emotional safety and driver behavior. The Physical Crash Verification Team at Volvo Cars Safety Centre is responsible to prepare, perform and verify physical crash tests deliver recommendations for further analysis, optimization and improvement of the safety performance in our future cars. You will be working closely with your team members and Engineering Manager.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Performance of physical tests for different load cases
  
Set up of test objects for physical crash verification
  
Participation in development of technical solutions
  
Definition and contribution in development of system requirements, guidelines and other knowledge building activities
  
  

Competence Requirements
  
MSc in Engineering
  
Proficient with the software tool Diadem, LS- Dyna, Ansa and Meta Post/Animator
  
Knowledge within occupant protection and structural crashworthiness for all major crash configurations.
  
Skilled in analysis for new safety solutions.
  
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  
High ability to work in team – personal skills to get things done in collaboration.
  
  

Meritorious Competences
  
Work experience from crash testing
  
Experience of testing preferably within Automotive Safety
  
**Skills in other important tools:** Team Center, Vis Mockup or Catia
  
  

Personal qualities
  
Should like to work collaboratively with others to achieve shared objectives.
  
Structured way of working, and good documentation skills.
  
Positive attitude.

title: SW and Electronics Test Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 3+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

Assignment Description
  
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a Software and Electronics Test Engineer. The In-house SW & Test team, which focuses on Side & Roof – Door, Locking, and Alarm functions, needs to strengthen their team with this role.
  
  

**Main Responsibilities:**  

Conduct test analysis, test planning, and define test methods as part of a dedicated team.
  
Write and execute tests across all abstraction layers in the V-model.
  
Plan features and stories within the In-house SW and Test team, focusing on door, locking, and alarm functions for verification and validation.
  
Perform fault tracing and administrative trace and coverage analysis on component nodes, system designs, and complete vehicle functions.
  
Work with various test infrastructures and assets, including HIL, SIL, and VIL environments.
  
Conduct real-life testing on test tracks or roads using test or released vehicles.
  
Develop the next generation of door, locking, and alarm functionalities while enhancing current solutions.
  
Address quality issues, implement running changes, and manage model year updates.
  
Ensure proficiency in electronics and hardware testing, as the product includes both software and hardware components.
  
Deliver work according to specified acceptance criteria and definitions.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Master of Science in electronics, mechatronics, applied physics, or a related field.
  
Swedish B-driver’s license.
  
Knowledge and understanding of reading electrical schematics and using instruments such as voltmeters, oscilloscopes, signal generators, etc.
  
Experience in the automotive industry.
  
Experience in automated verification of system design and software.
  
**Preferred experience with the following tools:** Elektra, Canalyzer/Canoe, Inca, DSA, CarConfig, CarCom.
  
Experience with test automation tools, e.g., Vector hardware & software.
  
  

**Desired Attributes:**  

Passion for quality and customer satisfaction.
  
Enthusiasm for new technologies, software and hardware testing, and creating great user experiences.
  
Positive and easy-going mindset.
  
Progressive attitude and a love for continuous improvement.
  
Team-oriented.
  
Curiosity and a strong self-driven approach.
  
Strong communication skills, both written and spoken, to explain complex issues.
  
Fluent in English; Swedish is a merit.

title: Camera Hardware & Component Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 2+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
Assignment Description
  
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking an experienced component design engineer to be part of their Exterior Camera sensor team.
  
In our client’s department within Safe Vehicle Automation, there are around 120 ambitious and highly skilled engineers creating tomorrow’s platform solutions for their active safety and self-driving vehicles. Their Agile Release Train (ART) Autonomous Drive & Advanced Driver Assistance System Platform develops the complete sensor and software platform for functions such as collision avoidance, automatic parking, and autonomous driving. Included in their responsibility is the design and verification of state-of-the-art LiDARs, ultrasonic sensors, cameras, and radars.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Participate as a curious and open-minded team player with a ”bring-it-on” mindset in the agile development team.
  
Define, guide, and integrate the Camera sensor mechanically and electrically into the vehicles.
  
Work closely with the team, suppliers, and other stakeholders to create different concepts and prototypes.
  
Verify concepts and prototypes before continuing to develop the final solution towards production intent.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

2-5 years of experience in automotive sensor integration.
  
Knowledge of Camera or Vision systems.
  
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in electronics, mechatronics, robotics, or similar fields.
  
Proven hands-on experience in developing automotive sensors or Camera sensor/systems from other industries.
  
Understanding of sensor performance, time, cost, and quality optimization.
  
Knowledge of modern materials and manufacturing processes.
  
Driver’s license (B, valid in the EU).
  
  

**Desired Attributes:**  

Passionate about self-driving vehicles and dedicated to enhancing the perception function for these vehicles.
  
Driven, structured, and resourceful team player.
  
Ability to deliver the ”how” and ”what” in a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and multicultural environment.
  
Skilled in managing complexity and uniting engineers to impact the product.
  
Excellent communication skills and proficiency in English, both verbally and in writing.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Development Engineer - Landskrona
description:
Do you want to become part of a highly skilled team of engineers, helping us develop future control systems from start to finish? We are now looking for our next Development Engineer, and maybe this opportunity is something for you!
  
Join our team in Landskrona, Sweden, and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
  
  

What you would do as our Development Engineer
  
As our new Development Engineer, you will join our Swing Door team, with 15 colleagues working with electronics and software engineering. We are developing and maintaining the control systems and electronic platforms for entrance systems. Since the control systems are used on many different products there is a lot of cooperation between the engineers. Within this role, together with the team, you will develop electronics and software for current and future control systems as well as test the product in controlled, real situations before going live according to test specifications.
  
  

**You would also:**  

* Interact with other engineering disciplines involved in the development such as mechanics and app development
* Define and execute tickets within a Scrum team
* Report progress and review current systems
* Present ideas for system improvements, including cost proposals
* Produce detailed specifications and writing program codes


The skills and experience you need
  
  

**We are looking for someone who:**  

* has a Degree in Engineering or similar
* has hands-on experience with Micro Processors, embedded programming and PCB design
* has excellent communication skills in English, spoken and written


It is a plus, but not required, to have experience of Power electronics for motor drives, Altium, EMC regulations and testing, battery in complex systems, test specifications and test equipment.
  
  

What we offer
  
We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress in a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
  
* Learning and career development opportunities, we are strong promotors of skills development and internal mobility opportunities
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes
* Flexible working hours
* Restaurant and lunch canteen at site
* 5-10 minutes’ walk from train station
* Health care allowance
* CBA and work shortening hours


We review applications regularly, so don’t wait
  
  

We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here, no later than 30th September 2024.
  
To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post.
  
If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at daria.skucha@assaabloy.com.
  
  

Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be subjected to a background screening. The performance of the background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
  
  

Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
  
  

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
  
  

We are the ASSA ABLOY Group
  
Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
  
  

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
  
  

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: Functional Application Lead Store Operations till Coop Sverige
description:
**Ansök nu**

Den goda kraften i mat-Sverige. Så vill vi beskriva Coop. Vill du vara med och utveckla Sveriges grönaste varumärke?


Vi vet att kraften i moderna IT-lösningar och förmågan att arbeta datadrivet och automatiserat kommer att vara nyckeln till framgång för vår affär och vår framtid. Coop Sverige har kommit långt genom de system och dedikerade medarbetare som lagt grunden för vår fortsatta utveckling som ett av Sveriges ledande och grönaste varumärken och nu har turen kommit till butiksdriften.


Nu söker vi en Functional Application Store Lead Operations till Coop Sverige


**Du kommer att arbeta med:**



Vi söker dig som har både potentialen och erfarenheten inom SAP men också kringliggande system för att utveckla och förvalta affärskritiska butiksdriftsprocesser, med primärt fokus på order- och lagerhantering i butik.


Som Functional Application Lead utgör du en central roll i förvaltning och utveckling av hållbara IT-lösningar med fokus på standardiserade uppsättningar.

* Du agerar verksamhetens spegling i driftsfrågor och är en del i arbete och beslutsprocess för utveckling och lösningar.
* Du ingår i ett Team med fokus på IT-lösningar i Butik, Shop n Tech, men jobbar även tillsammans med motsvarande din roll för andra verksamhetsområden inom Finans och Logistik.
* Rollen innebär tät dialog och samarbete med externa samarbetspartners och intressenter.


Vi står inför en design- och implementationsfas av en verksamhetsomspännande transformation och ska nu forma både processer och IT-stöd för Coops Föreningars butiksdrift och det ställer stora krav på omliggande systemlandskap och din roll blir central för att säkerställa kravbilder samt nödvändiga leveranser, i projekt såsom förvaltning.


Tjänsten är tillsvidare med 6 månaders provanställning med start enligt överenskommelse. Hemma eller på kontoret? Vi brukar säga ”laget för jaget” och förväntar oss att du är på kontoret när du behövs på plats helt enkelt. Vårt kontor är beläget i Solna Business Park.


  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du kan följande**


* Erfarenhet från relevant bransch, FMCG, med kunskaper inom Butiksprocesser. (Grocery retail är meriterande)
* Erfarenhet inom systemstöd, slutanvändargränssnitt och verksamhetsprocesser kopplat till order- och lagerhantering i butik.
* Dokumenterade SAP-kunskaper inom företrädesvis SAP MM och SAP CAR.
* Lösningsarkitekt, applikationsexpert, Software Engineer eller produktägare med minst några års erfarenheter från relevant verksamhet.
* Vana av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt, som deltagare eller projektledare.
* Erfarenhet från att arbeta med förvaltning och i verktyg såsom JIRA & Solution Manager.
* God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom exempelvis systemvetenskap eller för tjänsten relevant inriktning


**Personliga egenskaper vi gärna ser**



Som person tror vi att du är serviceinriktad, resultatdriven och en strukturerad problemlösare. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i en föränderlig miljö med förmåga att navigera i en komplex verksamhet där IT ska samspela och stötta vår verksamhet.



Dagligvaruhandeln är en stabil och långsiktig bransch, Coops erbjudande är nödvändigt och en viktig del i omställningen mot en grönare och hållbar framtid.



Du kommer att vara del av en företagskultur präglad prestigelöshet, initiativförmåga och starka värderingar. Vi tar gemensamt ansvar och har en stark vilja att hjälpa varandra att lyckas. Vårt kontor i Solna erbjuder en modern och bra arbetsmiljö med en fantastisk personalrestaurang. På Coop arbetar vi för våra 3,9 miljoner medlemmar och är därmed Sveriges i särklass största kooperation.



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Tove Nilsson; tove.nilsson@coop.se alt rekryteringskonsult Camilla Engström, camilla.engstrom@coop.se, tel: 0709-400203.



För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.


Coop värdesätter kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.


Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer!

title: Data Architect
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**


It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  



At Volvo Cars, our strategic direction is clear, shaping the future of mobility with human-centric technologies delivering the freedom to move in a personal, sustainable, and safe way. We are in the middle of a transformation to become a direct-to-consumer fully electric mobility company by 2030. Our cars will not only become electric, but they will also become defined by the software within them and how we use the data they collect in a responsible and safe way to improve and optimize the consumers’ mobility experience.

  


The automotive manufacturing industry is going through transformative change – building the factories of the future to drive electrification and beyond. Our current manufacturing transformation strategy takes us to 2027.

  


Our manufacturing transformation revolves around optimizing production capabilities and expanding manufacturing capacity to address the increasing demand for our vehicles effectively. Our commitment to electrification, a drive for cost optimization, and a culture of people development, collaboration, and best practice sharing anchors this approach.

  


The Volvo Data Vision of Powering innovation and every decision with trusted data. Our organizational data strategy drives our overall technology strategy (data mesh), how we govern, and our organizational operating model. We are working in manufacturing as a part of a whole, where the intention is to break down silos and build data and analytical products that are accessible and interoperable across Volvo Cars.

  


Aligned with this vision, the Manufacturing Data and Analytics Hub is responsible for developing and managing Data Products and Analytics Products for the Manufacturing function, enabling greater efficiency and better decision-making across Manufacturing.  



**What you'll do**

  


As a Data Architect, you will support Volvo Cars Manufacturing in achieving our objectives and becoming data-driven by designing and building a solid data backbone, laying the foundation for building cross-functional analytics at Volvo Cars.  

  

You will collaborate with stakeholders and data practitioners to establish the data architecture for Volvo Cars Manufacturing, covering both enterprise-wide data sets and specific use cases. Additionally, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the operational data architecture for Manufacturing.

  


Your main tasks and responsibilities will be to:


* Design, maintain, and review information and data models to align with our overall manufacturing reference data architecture and Volvo Cars data architecture.
* Define and support the implementation of solutions for integrating data from various sources to enable seamless data flows and enhanced data accessibility.
* Consult and advise business areas in data architecture best practices, ensuring they align with Volvo Cars' standards and guidelines.
* Identify, optimize, and advise on data creation, data flows and data transformation processes. Perform source-to-target mappings collaboratively with stakeholders.

  




This role is based in Gothenburg, Sweden, and Volvo Cars is an office-first culture so you will be expected to work the majority of time from our office in Torslanda, Gothenburg.

  


**What you'll bring**

  


We believe that you have a minimum of 5 years of experience in data architecture are very knowledgeable and passionate about modern data architectural practices and have end-to-end thinking. You have expert knowledge in data architecture, such as data standards, information modeling, data modeling, master data, and metadata. You also have a track record of guiding solution architects in regard to information architecture, especially master data management. You also have a validated ability to influence decision-making at all levels within an organization, and in a variety of contexts.

  


It is beneficial if you have:


* Knowledge of / experience with data mesh concepts.
* Prior experience within an automotive environment.
* Experience with knowledge graphs and semantic modeling.
* Well-established relevant network from which to draw advice, guidance, best practices, and industry developments.

  




**Want to know more?**

  


We invite you to apply in English at your earliest convenience. Please apply through the provided link. Applications submitted via email will not be retained or taken into consideration. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.

  


If you have any inquiries, please reach out to the Hiring Manager, Bengt Ellison at bengt.ellison@volvocars.com or Recruiter, Ayla Kutlay at ayla.kutlay@volvocars.com.

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here  

Curious about our story? Read more here
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Grid Engineer
description:
Interested?
  
Apply by clicking the apply button. We can not accept applications via e-mail. Submit your application, with resume and cover letter, by the 20th of August at the latest. If you want to hear more about the position, please get in touch with Head of Engineering- Wind and Solar, Carlos Tejada, by e-mail carlos.tejada@fortum.com before the application period deadline.
  
Please note that our recruiting team will be on vacation until 18th of August. As a result, the selection process and interviews will begin from the middle of August. We appreciate your patience and look forward to connecting with you soon!
  
Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of this page.
  
  

About the role
  
Your main responsibilities will encompass the assessment and design for high-voltage and medium-voltage substation connections during permitting and construction phases, while also being well-versed in the relevant Swedish grid legislation, key players and regulations, and being adept at creating technical reports, drawings, and engineering documents that meet local and international industry standards. The core responsibilities are the following:
  
**Grid Expertise:** Responsible for demonstrating proficiency in HV (High Voltage) and MV (Medium Voltage) substation connections, specifically catering to the renewables sector in the Nordic region.
  
  

**Regulatory Acumen:** Accountable for understanding Swedish grid legislation and translating regulatory changes into actionable guidelines for project management.
  
  

**Technical Oversight:** Tasked with conducting detailed technical reviews of grid connection designs to ensure compliance with industry standards for renewable energy systems.
  
  

**Stakeholder Engagement:** Expected to actively participate in discussions with national and European associations and communicate effectively with stakeholders on grid-related developments.
  
  

**Technical document Creation:** Responsible for generating and reviewing critical grid engineering documents and electrical drawings, including assessments for grid solutions.
  
  

**Project Support:** Provides essential technical support during project execution, particularly focusing on grid connection authorizations and permits.
  
  

**Best Practices Development:** Initiates the development of best practices and facilitates knowledge sharing on grid connections for Solar & Wind power plants, including hybrids.
  
  

**Project Execution Support:** Demonstrates expertise in grid connection authorizations, permits, and compliance with renewable energy system standards.
  
  

**Analysis and Due Diligence:** Conducts thorough grid availability analysis and due diligence for internal and third-party projects.
  
  

**Collaboration and Liaison:** Acts as a bridge between development teams and technical teams, managing grid-related topics effectively.
  
  

**Technical Specifications Maintenance:** Contributes to the maintenance of grid and electrical technical specifications in partner contracts
  
  

About you
  
We are seeking a self-driven individual with strong initiative who can manage multiple projects and stakeholders effectively. You should be a collaborative communicator with negotiation skills and a results-oriented mindset, thriving in a multicultural environment. Additionally, we value an open-minded innovator with a strategic mindset, capable of advancing renewable energy initiatives through innovative grid solutions.
  
  

**In the position of Senior Grid Engineer, we see that you have:**
  
An advanced degree in electrical engineering, electric power engineering or in another related field.
  
  

Solid understanding of the Swedish grid codes, key industry contacts and knowledge of the renewables value chain.
  
  

Several years of experience focused on utility-scale renewable projects, consulting or project engineering.
  
  

Proficiency in MS 365 and are well acquainted with power system analysis software like Digsilent Power Factory, PSCAD, or similar.
  
  

Demonstrated experience in the design and connection of HV and MV substations.
  
  

Ability to work with DSO/TSOs to secure and optimize grid connections for new projects and an understanding of power systems, grid technical requirements, and experience with grid operators’ connection processes.
  
  

Proven experience in negotiating electrical and grid contracts and in the preparation and review of tender and contract documents.
  
  

Fluency in written and spoken Swedish and English is critical; additional language skills, especially Finnish or Norwegian, are highly valued.
  
  

A willingness to travel locally and internationally based on project needs. Usually 1-2 times per month, for a 1-3 day period (in Sweden and Finland, but also within EU).

title: iOS Developer  (Intern)
description:
We are a pioneering technology company harnessing the power of machine learning and advanced research to deliver exceptional augmented reality 👓 (AR) solutions for industrial enterprises.
 



 Our innovative AR technology revolutionizes traditional work methods, inspiring new ways of thinking and unlocking groundbreaking solutions that were previously beyond reach in industry and machine operations.
 



  





 You will be a part of the product team.
 



 In your role, you will be a part of shaping our future AR product with focus on
 



 our application for both Mobile devices and Head mounted XR glasses.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 



* Conduct research on technology solutions
* Designing, developing, and testing UI for mobile and XR applications
* Problem solving
* Code and learn new technologies in the XR Space
* Solving market challenges together with the team with our groundbreaking product.



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have:** 



* Experience of using Xcode - SwiftUi.
* Experience of programming languages Swift
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Freedom under own responsibility
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





**This is a unpaid internship initially**

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
***We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm. Do you have excellent programming skills and are you interested in working on the frontline of artificial intelligence? Do you like strategic discussions, interacting with customers and people about their real applications? If so, this role is for you!***




  





**About Imagimob** 





 Imagimob is a scale-up driving innovation at the forefront of Edge AI and tinyML—and enabling the intelligent products of the future. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, the company has been serving global customers within the automotive, manufacturing, healthcare, and lifestyle industries since 2013. In 2020, Imagimob launched their SaaS solution, Imagimob AI for the swift and easy end-to-end development of Edge AI applications for devices with constrained resources. We are working closely with customers and partners from Europe, North America and Asia-Pacific.
 




  






 In May 2023, 
 
 Infineon Technologies AG
 
  acquired 100% of the shares in Imagimob. Imagimob belongs to the Connected Secure Systems (CSS) division.
 




  






 Today we are a team of almost 20 employees, divided into three teams: Sales & Marketing, Product Development and Customer Success.
 




  





**About the position** 





 At Imagimob, you will become a key member of our cross-functional teams, collaborating with innovative AI engineers to develop the next generation of AI-powered products. As a member of our “Customer Success” team, you will work closely with our customers and take an active role in everything from AI Modelling, programming, collecting data to system testing and verification. Since many of our projects are breaking new grounds, your creativity will be challenged on a daily basis. If you love thinking outside the box and get inspired by hard engineering problems, this job will be a great fit. Since we are covering many topics, you will also be able to develop in the areas you find the most interesting. 
 





  
 





 In the Customer Success team, we focus on time-series, modal and sensor data, including but not limited to; audio, radar data, electrical signals etc. Our work is centred around refining our model development pipeline, ensuring that we build and deploy models efficiently, and applying our learnings to a variety of cases. We emphasise streamlining processes to deliver models quickly and developing the infrastructure to support them. 
 




  





**What you will do** 



* Provide rapid solutions to customers using our products and services.
* Tackle a diverse range of customer challenges and issues.
* Participate in strategic planning, contribute to shaping our product offerings, and drive initiatives that align with our long-term vision
* Develop and deploy efficient AI/ML solutions for edge applications.
* Collaborate with the product team to create customer-specific solutions.
* Work with the sales team to promote products and projects.
* Contribute to the development of infrastructure supporting model deployment and efficiency.



  





**We are looking for someone who has:** 



* Excellent programming skills in Python, and preferably even some knowledge C & C#
* Experience in working with machine learning and running models in production
* Experience working and upholding high programming standards
* Good knowledge of data analysis, statistics, signal processing and its practical applications
* University degree or equivalent experience in computer science, electrical engineering, engineering physics or similar
* Somebody with ownership and initiative - who is interested in participating in strategy discussions and shaping the future of our products.
* Desire for flexibility and handling new tasks or work as it comes in
* Experience working independently as well as helping colleagues achieve their goals so that customers are satisfied



  





**Good if you also gave:** 



* Experience working with audio data
* Experience in developing on embedded platforms
* Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g. Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Caffe)
* Experience in developing and deploying machine learning solutions in real-world applications
* Experience in programming in C#
* Experience in working closely with customers
* Interest in educating customers about machine learning



  





**What we offer:** 



* The opportunity to further develop our development platform, responsible for bringing deep learning to the edge
* Being a part of an excellent international team with highly motivated individuals striving for a common goal
* A chance to be a part of solving real-world problems using ML
* Competitive salary, wellness allowance, possibility to attend online courses during working hours and option program
* A humble and open-minded company culture
* Opportunities to grow with the company and advance your career
* Short decision paths, we love getting things done
* An office in central Stockholm and the flexibility of working from home



  






 Are you the person we described above? Then click apply!
 




  






 If you have any questions about the role, please contact zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com.

title: Senior Analysis SW Engineer – 10132
description:
We are looking for a Senior Analysis SW Engineer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Design and develop software products for Life Science applications, including instrument control software, user interfaces (GUI), system software, and image analysis software.
* Contribute to the software development lifecycle from initiation to launch.
* Draft and manage requirements and work items for the development backlog.
* Plan and execute your own tasks while contributing to overall team planning.
* Engage in code reviews, create unit tests, and support the creation of high-quality software.



  





**What you bring:** 



* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Extensive experience in software development for Life Science instrumentation or similar products.
* Experience with SCRUM or other agile methodologies.
* Expert programming skills in at least one major language (Python, C++, C#, Java), with extensive experience in Python.
* Proficiency in handling large data sets, including image data and data generated during analysis.
* Experience utilizing dedicated hardware (e.g., GPUs) to enhance software performance.
* Familiarity with tools and libraries such as pytest, SQLite, pandas, and numpy.
* Strong troubleshooting and bug-fixing skills.
* Experience working in a Linux environment.
* Experience with embedded systems and Python architecture for large-scale projects is a plus.
* Knowledge of JIRA for project management and experience integrating Python with C/C++/Rust are advantageous.
* Understanding of test and verification strategies, including code reviews and unit testing.
* Experience with software deployment setup (e.g., Yocto) is desirable.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**Would you like to contribute to electrifying heavy transports to reduce our CO2 footprint?**
 Scania is ongoing a transformation journey within electrification and this means a new way of working as well as new types of products. Our team is a testing and calculation group working with propulsion development, which is an essential part of this transformation. We work according to the agile methodology and SAFe framework. Experimenting is a part of our routine and it has resulted in many great methods and collaboration between test engineers and simulation engineers.
   

  

 We are now looking for you that want to contribute to this and join our team as a Test Engineer!
   

  

**This is us**
 The team consists of 2 Test Engineers, 13 Simulation Engineers, and one Manager. We have different work experiences, nationalities, genders, and ages, which we have found to be a success factor for our delivery. Many of us have worked together for several years, fostering a culture of teamwork and cohesiveness in the group. We have a lot of focus days, group learning sessions, and group activities. Many of us also like to hang out after work, so the team often arranges after-work and other activities where everyone is invited. All these together, have contributed to our great team spirit. The team is very helpful and great at onboarding new team members and you will have a dedicated supervisor during your first period. On a personal note, I have been leading this group for 5 years as a manager and I have also been a calculation engineer before that, working with Durability!
   

  

**We offer**
 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks working on-site at our testing facility in Södertälje. We can also provide you with a development plan, so you can reach your goals and receive the right support along the way. Scania offers many opportunities to develop your career both within the country as well as internationally. The professional development of our employees is a priority for us, so education via internal and external courses is encouraged and supported.
   

  

 In addition to career and development opportunities, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company, and much more. Scania also organizes several events yearly where family and friends are always welcome. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**Your assignment**
 As a Test Engineer within our team, you will work with durability and static rigg testing of our components for the electrified powertrain where method development is needed to understand new solutions and their associated failure modes. Your assignment will include plan, prepare and perform rigg testing of strength and durability as well as life length testing on our electrified propulsion system as well as conventional drivetrains. The role also requires you to be part of method development, rigg development, and process improvement for testing. Verifying simulations with your test results and finding capability for your tests is an important aspect of the job.
   

  

*Examples of tasks could be..*
* Plan and prepare for tests.
* Coordinate your test with mechanics.
* Performing static or life-length tests on transmission components.
* Calibrating components for vehicle testing.
* Suggest and order rigg designs or updates.
* Writing test reports.


**Your profile**
 To succeed in this role we believe that you are organized and structured. You are solution-oriented and seek collaboration and synergies. You find coordination and planning fun. You strive for autonomy, act with a high sense of responsibility, and have the endurance to finish off what you have started. You enjoy working with your hands on real components and find building and repairing stimulating.
   

  

*We would also like that..*
* You have a bachelor's degree in engineering.
* You write and speak fluently in English.


*If you have the following, it is merit..*
* Master in solid mechanics with courses like fatigue, dynamics, or material mechanics.
* Work experience with testing or simulations.
* Experience in designing Riggs.


**At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.**
**In the team, we have both junior and senior co-workers, so all levels of experience are welcome to apply!**
**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position or group please don't hesitate to contact Anna Glassel (Group Manager, ENTAC), at anna.x.glassel@scania.com.
   

  

**Application**
 If this sounds like you and you find the challenges interesting, we are very happy to receive your application!
   

  

 Your application should include a
 **CV** 
 and an
 **education certificate** 
 . Please apply as soon as possible but no later than
 **2024-08-25** 
 .
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

*Due to the vacation period, we will start handling the applications and answering questions from the 12th of August. From that week, we will have an ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the last application period, therefore the position may be filled before the end of the application period.*
**Welcome to apply!**
*Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit:* 
*www.scania.com*

title: Erfaren .NET Utvecklare till Fintech-bolag på uppgång
description:
Nu är vi på jakt efter en .Net utvecklare till ett härligt Fintech bolag här i Stockholm. Du kommer tillsammans med ett agilt team utveckla skräddarsydda finansiella lösningar till era kunder på en social och rolig arbetsplats. Så om du har jobbat med C# utveckling i tre år eller mer, sök nu!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm innerstan
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som .NET-utvecklare hos vår kund som levererar finansiella lösningar till sina kunder kommer du att vara en nyckelmedlem i teamet av utvecklare där du är delaktig i att designa, utveckla och underhålla applikationer. Du kommer att arbeta med en bred portfölj av projekt, samarbeta i team där att skriva kod av hög kvalité är av största vikt.
 


  


 Bolaget är del av en större koncern som funnits i snart 25 år. Nu testar de vingarna och har brutit sig ut från moderskeppet och i och med det anställer de fler kollegor. Du kommer att vara baserad på kontoret i Stockholm med en flexibilitet att jobba hemifrån 50% av tiden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En arbetsplats med härliga kollegor och bra arbetsklimat
  
* En attraktiv lön
  
* Nyrenoverade lokaler mitt inne i stan med hemtrevlig stämning
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckla och underhålla .NET-applikationer i C#
  
* Arbeta i en agil möjlig där du kommer samarbeta med flera olika team-kollegor dagligen
  
* Felsöka och lösa programvarufel och problem
  
* Då högkvalitativ kod är av största prioritet kommer ni kodgranska tillsammans
  
* Du kommer vara med och ta beslut kring design och arkitektur
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av .Net utveckling, med huvuddelen i frontend
  
* Är väl bevandrad inom C# programmering
  
* Har kunskap av att jobba i databaser och SQL
  
* Språk: Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift
  
* Utbildning: En akademisk examen inom systemutveckling, datateknik eller liknande
  


  

  

  

  

  


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en driven individ som tycker om att lära dig nya tekniker och hålla dig uppdaterad på det senaste.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Problemlösande**
  
* **Samarbetsorienterad**
  
* **Driven**
  
* **Konsultmässig**
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 



 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på nils.norgren@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105257

title: Test Engineer, Transmission Development
description:
Do you have a few years’ experience as a Test Engineer? Do you want to join Scania’s Transmission development?
   

  

 Did you know that we are making the biggest investment in Scania’s history to enter the Chinese market with a new brand, factory and local supplier network? Nevertheless, one of your main tasks here would be to test and evaluate the outsourcing of our latest transmission to China.
   

  

 More specifically, my group, ENTBM Inner Maneuvering, design and test high-performing mechanical components allowing for best-in-class gear shifting properties, enabling our combustion and electric engines to operate at their most efficient point thereby minimizing fuel / energy consumption - a crucial property for our customers profitability as well as the environment
   

  

**Key Requirements**
 Together with our designers you would create the test plan and define the tests (load cases, test cycles and acceptance criteria). You would then be the main responsible for securing test material, having the test units prepared by our workshop technicians, getting the test units or components installed in the rig, connecting all necessary measuring equipment and writing the code for the test program. Since
 *coding is a vital part of your role you need to have some coding experience* 
 . Finally, you and the designer analyse the results together and you write the test report.
   

  

**More About You**
 To be successful at and enjoy this position I think you have to have a strong interest in technology. You like to work with many different people with different expertise to solve complex problems. You are analytical and hands-on, and appreciate not knowing exactly what your work will look like day to day. You have to be driven, self-going, curious and a good communicator. You are fluent in written and spoken English. Preferably good at Swedish.
   

  

**We offer**
 In return, you would become part of a really good workplace with great people. Who appreciate and help each other out, share knowledge and discuss all topics openly. Which also shows in our customer satisfaction surveys. And for me as a manager, I do my utmost to be available for support, help in prioritization etc and my management style is very much based on trust.
   

  

 As a company Scania offers a wide range of trainings, flexible working hours, a possibility to work from home up to 20%. You also get benefits such as bonus, parental benefits and wellness allowance. And if you live in Stockholm we offer a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Job express.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact our recruiting manager, Björn Gunnarsson, at +46700883261. We will be interviewing continuously, so don’t hesitate to apply (Just Do It)
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Ab Initio Developer - Meta Programming/ETL
description:
We have been retained by a leading Financial Services customer as they seek an Ab Initio Developer to join on a full-time, freelance basis.
   

  

 You will be responsible for developing and automating data sourcing ETL pipelines using Ab Initio, with a focus on metadata-driven development. This role involves close collaboration with data engineers and business stakeholders to deliver scalable and efficient data integration solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and automate ETL processes using Ab Initio for the Enterprise Analytics Platform.
* Implement metadata-driven pipelines and engage in meta-programming to optimise data workflows.
* Collaborate with teams to meet data requirements and enhance business analytics.
* Maintain and troubleshoot ETL processes to ensure high performance.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience with Ab Initio and ETL processes.
* Strong skills in metadata-driven development and meta-programming.
* Experience in financial data systems is preferred.


**This is an urgent role with interviews being arranged for next week so please apply today if this sounds like an exciting next step for you!**

title: Data Scientist in Computer Vision
description:
Scania aims to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating a world of mobility that is better for business, society, and the environment. Our department plays a central role in this journey by providing the information, tools, and systems needed to maintain, diagnose, repair, and upgrade the products qualitatively and cost-effectively.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a highly motivated and skilled team that values each other's ideas and supports one another whenever needed. Working in an agile manner, we continuously strive to enhance our methods. The team comprises Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our journey thus far has been notable, solidifying our reputation as a leading AI team engaged in the entire development process—from data collection to modelling, testing, and deploying ML models in production. However, to further elevate our achievements and scale our initiatives, it's imperative that our team grows.
   

  

**You will together with the team**
* Develop, implement, and maintain state-of-the-art YOLO object detection models tailored for real-time applications, specifically in vehicle maintenance workshops.
* Develop and evaluate different methods and frameworks to enhance YOLO object detection model performance in a production environment, optimizing data collection and annotation processes.
* Utilize Active Learning techniques to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the training process by selecting the most informative data points from large-scale video streams.
* Optimize data annotation processes and manage the challenges of handling large volumes of video data in real-time, ensuring high-quality model training data.
* Utilize Agile methodology to ensure efficient and value-driven project delivery.


 As a key member of our Data Science team, you will collaborate with diverse teams across the organization, from R&D to Sales & Marketing and beyond, as well as with other Data Science teams at Scania.
   

  

**Our dream candidate**
**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* A background in engineering and a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
* Solid knowledge and experience in Image/Video processing, YOLOv8, evaluation metrics for object detection (such as IoU and mAP), Deep Learning, Python, AWS, and Active Learning Frameworks.
* The ability to work independently and effectively within an Agile environment and to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.


 As a person, we expect you to be structured, communicative, and service-minded. Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is essential.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer an inspiring workplace, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.
   

  

 In addition, we offer benefits such as employee car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Please contact Jesper Brauer, Head of Strategic Product Planning and Advanced Analytics, +46 8 553 50078.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a
 **CV** 
 ,
 **personal letter** 
 , and
 **grade copies** 
 . Please apply as soon as possible but no later than
 **2024-08-29** 
 . Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!

title: Test Engineer - Bus Chassis Testing
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 Do you possess practical skills, yet have a strong analytic ability? Then you might be the one we are searching for.
   

  

 The group Bus Chassis Testing is growing, and we are now hiring!
   

  

 The group's responsibility lies within testing as well as ownership of the vehicle properties such as braking, steering, handling, ride and vibration comfort. We also perform strength, fuel system and gas exchange testing. Testing is being performed on a whole vehicle level, system level and in test rigs.
   

  

 As a test engineer in our group, you will be a part of our team, which consists of twelve test engineers, one scrum master, one product owner and the group manager. Within the group you will be working independently and as a team to reach our goals. This sets the demand on each one to commit, engage and lead themselves and their colleagues towards the set goals. With high participation and commitment, risk management and a direct action on deviations, we do this best together.
   

  

**Work tasks**
 As a test engineer with within the bus chassis testing group braking and chassis level control you will work with testing required for function development as well as verification. In the job testing with suppliers, authorities and hot/ cold climate testing is included. We cooperate with authorities and suppliers mainly in Europe, but also in other continents. Due to this travelling might be needed at certain times.
   

  

 Within the team, we work partly on assignments from other groups and partly on assignments from ourselves from a property perspective. As a test engineer, you are the assignment leader for your test. You are responsible for planning, coordinating cross-functionally, carrying out, analysing, and reporting assignments. The role also includes supporting our field quality organization with investigations and troubleshooting, when there’s a need.
   

  

 To be successful in this job you need to have good communication skills and a good dialog with your cross functions. Typical cross functions for this job are mechanics, designers, calculation- and simulation teams and other cross functions such as system and function owners, cert. engineers and other sister groups doing the same tasks for trucks.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You most likely have a Master's or a Bachelor of Science and a big technical interest and enjoys working with vehicles. Knowledge regarding measurement techniques and analysis of measurement data and metric processing is a part of the daily work and is needed to be able to fulfil this job.
   

  

**If Possible, We Would Also Like You To Have**
* Drivers licence C or/and D
* Programming competence in Matlab, Python or competence with measurement systems such as: CANape, IPEmotion and Dewesoft and Scanias diagnosis tool XCOM, Gadet, CDev and SDP3
* Experience within the field of vehicle testing


 You are a team player who can work independently when needed. As a person, you are structured, thorough and take initiative. It’s easy for you to cooperate with other people both in written and spoken language and you are responsive to others' needs.
   

  

 You have good knowledge in English and basic in Swedish both in written and spoken language.
   

  

**Is vehicle testing a passion of yours?** 
 Do you want to be a part of development and put the requirements on the design through testing? Then this could be your dream job!
   

  

**For Further Information, Please Contact**
 Markus Vitkalla, tel: +46 8 553 81737 (Manager) or Martin Bergqvist (Senior Engineer) +46 8 553 80041.
   

  

**Application**
 Apply by 22nd of August at the latest.
   

  

 The application should include a personal letter, CV and grade copies. Do you want to join our team? Welcome to apply.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: FEM Engineer, Battery Development
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 Join us!
   

  

 Are you seeking an opportunity to influence in a new exciting area of technology? Do you also wish to be part of a team with value-creating development in focus? We are looking for an experienced simulation engineer to support us with the challenge of developing the best modular energy storage system for future heavy trucks and buses. Previous battery knowledge is meritorious but not a must, you contribute with your skillset and motivation, and we will help each other develop our battery knowledge together.
   

  

 What’s in it for you?
   

  

* You get to play an important role in development of a state-of-the-art energy storage system.
* Focus on value creation development.
* Be a part of a competent and dedicated multiskilled team in an expansively and exciting area of technology.


 The Battery simulation team is responsible for the evaluation of the internal structure and the electric, thermal and dynamic properties, in close collaboration with battery development, you will be a part of development of the future battery platform for Scania and TRATON Group.
   

  

 Your work assignments
   

  

 At the group EVBPS, we are simulation engineers with competence within structural- or fluid mechanics. We work in a SAFE structure where you as a simulation engineer work in teams, side by side, with designers and testing to develop future products. Within EVBPS you are supported by simulation colleagues through competence groups and together you work with the long-term method development of the area.
   

  

 As a Simulation Engineer Within Structural Mechanics, You Perform Simulations Both On Component And System Level With Either a Static Or Dynamic Model. With Your Simulation Results As a Base, You Contribute To The Team And Product Development By
   

  

* Communicate and disseminate your findings in oral and written form, and in large and small forums.
* Compare and correlate calculation results with physical testing, where your conclusions provide further guidance for the team.
* Continually evaluate improvement opportunities for accuracy, and calculation time by starting from sample data, software and process improvements.
* Aligning methos and improvement work cross brands in the TRATON group.


 What do we seek?
   

  

 We believe that it is important that you are driven and have experience in performing FEA analysis independently. Working in an agile cross-functional environment requires good communication with people from different working areas.
   

  

**We Believe You Are**
* Experienced simulation engineer.
* Communicative team player.
* Open for an agile development mindset.
* User experience from ABACUS, Hypermesh is meritorious.


 As Scania is an international company, we see that you are fluent in English.
   

  

 If you are the one we are looking for we can promise you a position where you will grow as an engineer and take your expertise to the next level.
   

  

 For more information
   

  

 Please contact: Peter Rosén, Head of Battery Simulation Tel: 08-553 71422, e-post: peter.rosen@scania.com
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this role.

title: Business Intelligence Developer- Acceleration Nordics
description:
Welcome to join an experienced and growing team of BI Developers, Data scientists and Consultants who work to drive increased marketing effectiveness for some of Sweden's and the world's largest brands.
   

  

 As part of the leading media agency group GroupM, we at Acceleration work to transform large amounts of data into solutions to complex problems in media and marketing. The projects include a broad mix of econometrics, media buying algorithms, dashboards and strategy projects/consulting services.
   

  

 Acceleration drives GroupM and the rest of the industry forward through technology and data innovation and works closely with the largest advertisers, publishers and technology companies in the industry. This is a position with a plethora of opportunities for growth both professionally and personally.
   

  

**About The Position**
 In this role, you will be responsible for the operation and development of our Business Intelligence solutions as part of our Swedish Business Intelligence Team. This includes self-service analytics, data engineering, data platforms, and data visualization. Your primary responsibilities will be to manage the development of data models, dashboards, and technical solutions for data pipelines. You will also work on automating data processes for our clients and internal projects.
   

  

 In addition to the above, we are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has strong analytical skills and are detail oriented
* Has experience and a passion for data visualization and presentation.
* Has worked with Power BI (or other visualization tool)
* Enjoys working with BI, SQL, databases, and ELT/ETL processes, considering them your home turf.
* Holds at least a bachelor's degree relevant to BI/Analytics and preferably has work experience in the field.
* Has excellent communication and presentation skills.
* It's a plus if you know Python or another scripting language and have an interest in learning more about statistics and data science.


**Our offer**
 With us, you get the opportunity to work with many of Sweden's and the world's most ambitious brands, together with a team that is passionate about digital marketing, and with market-leading technologies.
   

  

 You will sit in central premises on Birger Jarlsgatan with inspiring colleagues from different backgrounds, who together drive digital marketing to the next level through innovation and solid work. Furthermore, there are great opportunities for personal development and career development within GroupM Sweden, as well as within our global network.
   

  

 We are part of WPP, a large international group, and we work to combine the best of these two worlds. You are offered to work in a stimulating and developing workplace with a high comfort factor and colleagues who are close to laughing.
   

  

 In addition to the obvious, such as good working conditions, pleasant working environment and exciting challenges, there are a couple of things that make working here a little extra good:
   

  

* Great participation and opportunity to be involved and influence your daily work
* Short decision-making paths and great closeness between management and employees
* We think that a balance between work, leisure and personal development is important
* Wellness allowance of SEK 3,000/year and several attractive staff benefits
* We offer market-adapted pension terms and private pension advice via our partner Nordea
* We have occupational health care via Feelgood and additional health insurance via Euro Accident
* Conferences, kick-offs and other fun that we do together
* Office centrally located in the middle of Stockholm city on Birger Jarlsgatan


**Application**
 The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Alexandra Lindh, Business Intelligence Engineer & Team Lead at alexandra.lindh@acceleration.biz. We do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About GroupM**
 GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Acceleration. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
At Doktor.Se we're searching for an experienced iOS engineer to join our development team focused on patient healthcare experience within our Swedish market.
 



  





 Our team’s mission is to provide high-quality and streamlined healthcare experience which improve patient outcomes with proactive support and precise care direction, and to help our medical staff by efficiently preparing each case and optimising workflows.
 



  





**About Doktor.Se** 




 At Doktor.Se we are reinventing the way the Swedish health care system works by making it more accessible, convenient and efficient without compromising on quality and safety. We work closely with the medical staff, nurses and doctors with many years of experience in the medical field to develop the best experience for both patients and staff.
 



  





 Our hybrid model of owning health clinics (vårdcentraler) around Sweden and building our own digital solutions has proven to be very successful with millions of registered users, millions of consultations every year and a strong year over year growth. Our model puts patients first and adds value to all stakeholders. We’re proud of our 95% patient satisfaction and we maintain an average app store ranking over 4.5/5. We are also the most popular digital healthcare employer in Sweden.
 



  





**Job Description** 




 At Doktor.se you will develop brand new features as well as improve and optimise our existing services. We mostly work within the Swedish market but we also maintain some core services which are used in multiple markets around the world.
 



  





 You will be working in a small, cross-functional team with full-stack, front-end and mobile app developers in close collaboration with our product manager and designers. Your main responsibilities will be focused on the iOS app, but with a smaller team we must help where we are needed, giving opportunity to personal growth in new areas if you want. The team has a lot of autonomy in how we solve technical problems and the way we work so we’re looking for somebody who enjoys making the work environment as well as the tech stack even better.
 



 While our team is small, we integrate with many other systems in our platform, which means you’ll get to work with other teams and technologies to ensure that we create the best results and have a harmonious platform and app.
 



  





 You have a track record working on iOS applications using Swift. You can show strong knowledge of Swift, design patterns and best practices related to developing mobile apps for the iOS platform.
 



  





 You are familiar with UIKit, SwiftUI, Combine, Auto Layout and other foundational Apple frameworks. You probably have hands on experience working on CI/CD pipelines using Fastlane.
 



 You have an interest and passion for building consumer-facing products, and you care about the experience we ship. You have practical knowledge of iOS UI/UX guidelines and understand the importance of delivering a great user experience. You enjoy working closely with designers to produce both beautiful and functional apps.
 



  





 As a senior engineer we expect you can design and architect apps from the ground up with minimal guidance, knowing which design patterns to use and write well-structured and testable code. You support other team members and drive our functional guilds to improve our tech stack for everybody at the company.
 



  





 We speak many languages, but our main communication language is English. Swedish or experience with or from the Swedish healthcare system is a big plus.
 



  





**We offer you** 




 Every employee is equally important to the success of Doktor.se! We are driven by seeing people grow and develop, therefore we create opportunities to work in what you are passionate about. Together we create a great team spirit, culture, and community. We are passionate about giving all people a healthier life, work-life balance is something that is highly valued. We offer you competitive salary package, 30 days of paid vacation per year, collective agreements, ITP1 (pension plan), top-quality working equipment, wellness allowances, phenomenal colleagues, a beautiful office in the central of Stockholm and remote work options.
 



  





 We also offer you a laptop and phone and any other office equipment you might need. We do not dictate what software you use to get your work done, so you get to pick the OS and tools that best suit you, in the tech team we are about 70% macOS, 30% Linux.
 



  





**Additional Information** 



* Start: As soon as possible, respecting any notice period
* Type of role: Full-time, until further notice, with an initial probation period
* Office Policy: We like to meet in the office which means we work three days per week from the office, then flexible remote on Tuesdays and Fridays.
* Location: Sveavägen 63, Stockholm.
* We offer no Visa Sponsorships or relocation packages.
* No Consultants and No Recruiters thank you.



  





*Take this great opportunity to work in an innovative, fast, and dedicated environment - we are looking forward to your application!*

title: Business Intelligence Developer- Acceleration Nordics
description:
Welcome to join an experienced and growing team of BI Developers, Data scientists and Consultants who work to drive increased marketing effectiveness for some of Sweden's and the world's largest brands.
   

  

 As part of the leading media agency group GroupM, we at Acceleration work to transform large amounts of data into solutions to complex problems in media and marketing. The projects include a broad mix of econometrics, media buying algorithms, dashboards and strategy projects/consulting services.
   

  

 Acceleration drives GroupM and the rest of the industry forward through technology and data innovation and works closely with the largest advertisers, publishers and technology companies in the industry. This is a position with a plethora of opportunities for growth both professionally and personally.
   

  

**About The Position**
 In this role, you will be responsible for the operation and development of our Business Intelligence solutions as part of our Swedish Business Intelligence Team. This includes self-service analytics, data engineering, data platforms, and data visualization. Your primary responsibilities will be to manage the development of data models, dashboards, and technical solutions for data pipelines. You will also work on automating data processes for our clients and internal projects.
   

  

 In addition to the above, we are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has strong analytical skills and are detail oriented
* Has experience and a passion for data visualization and presentation.
* Has worked with Power BI (or other visualization tool)
* Enjoys working with BI, SQL, databases, and ELT/ETL processes, considering them your home turf.
* Holds at least a bachelor's degree relevant to BI/Analytics and preferably has work experience in the field.
* Has excellent communication and presentation skills.
* It's a plus if you know Python or another scripting language and have an interest in learning more about statistics and data science.


**Our offer**
 With us, you get the opportunity to work with many of Sweden's and the world's most ambitious brands, together with a team that is passionate about digital marketing, and with market-leading technologies.
   

  

 You will sit in central premises on Birger Jarlsgatan with inspiring colleagues from different backgrounds, who together drive digital marketing to the next level through innovation and solid work.
